loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is married and has three children, all adults. She sells food products, green vegetables, tomatoes and citrus fruit at retail and to small-business customers and her neighbors. She also sells charcoal for an additional source of income.

Jumwa began her life as a merchant ten years ago with the goal of working on her own and contributing to the support of her household. With very little education, she thought that gradually it would become an option for self-employment that would allow her to get ahead and achieve growth for herself and her family.

Jumwa still plans to grow gradually and is coming for a Kiva loan, her third financing from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She wants to use the loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. Jumwa's investment will be successful because it is based on market demand and on her vast business experience.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mwanafuraha

texts.en:
Mwanafuraha lives in Tiribe, Kenya with her one child who is two years old. She dreams of a promising future in which she will be able to provide her little one with the potential for success. Her child is the motivation behind her work selling fast food such as French fries. Her business is open on weekends and holidays. It is located in her home and she sells for cash to passersby in her area as well as to neighbors, family members and friends. They are familiar with the products that Mwanafuraha prepares and are loyal to her business. Mwanafuraha's goal is to achieve sustainable growth and, in this way, improve her family's income. Her biggest challenge is to build up enough working capital to be able to grow her business. 

Mwanafuraha is currently applying for a Kiva loan (her second loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust). She will use it to buy supplies such as sauces, breads, sausages and meat in larger volumes so that she can develop her offerings even further.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sauces, breads, sausages and meat

loans.name: Fimbo

texts.en:
Fimbo is married and lives in Kwale with his wife. Fimbo's business is buying and selling of meat goats at the market to butcher shop operators. He started his business one year ago, with a small amount of capital; he started buying goats to raise in his yard, fattening them and selling them. He is supported in this business by his wife.

Fimbo's business has gradually grown and now his main customers are not only neighbours but also restaurants and businesses that sell special meals. This helps him ensure his business' growth as they always refer new buyers to him. 

Fimbo's main challenge is having enough working capital to buy more goats to increase his income. For this reason, he is requesting a Kiva loan to buy goats for resale. This will help increase his income which his family depends upon.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет четверых детей: двух дочерей и двух сыновей. Она обратилась за займом первый раз. Она участвовала на тренинге  «Женщина предприниматель- добейся успеха». Она очень хочет открыть парикмахерскую у дома. В настоящее  время она   оказывает услуги компьютера в Пролетарском районе. Гулнора также принимала участие на  месячном тренинге парикмахерских услуг и имеет сертификат. Данный момент она хочет работать на основе данного сертификата. Она хотела бы получить займ для покупки ножниц, зеркал, оборудования для парикмахерской. Она надеется на вашу помощь, которая позволит ей осуществить её мечту.
texts.en: Gulnora is a kind and hardworking woman.  She is married and raising four children: two daughters and two sons.  She requested a loan from us for the first time.  Gulnora participated in the "Woman entrepreneur - achieve success" training.  She really wants to open a hair salon at home.  Currently, she provides computer services in the Proletarskiy district.  Gulnora also took part in a monthly training of hair stylist services and has a certificate.  At the present time, she wants to work with this certificate.  Gulnora wants to obtain this loan to buy scissors, mirrors and hair salon equipment.  She relies on your help, which would allow her to achieve her dream.

loans.use: tо purchase scissors, mirrors, hair salon equipment

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 30,000 to boost her fruits and vegetables stall business. Riziki tells us that there are products she does not have and that are highly sought after by people who come to this market so she wants to invest in the purchase of lots of her fruit and vegetable stand in order to satisfy a larger clientele.

Her only way of doing this is accessing a loan which will be her fourth with Yehu Microfinance Trust which is the intermediary institution for this loan transaction. She is considered to be a good client because of her punctuality with payments and because her business has improved considerably.

loans.use: To purchase bags of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits

loans.name: Chipenyo

texts.en: Chipenyo is taking out another Kiva loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to boost her motorcycle business. With the loan she plans to purchase another motorcycle for her business. She remarks that her job is very difficult because during the rainy season she has a lot of obstacles since she has fewer passengers since it's cold. Her dream is to buy more motorcycles to work and thus make progress every day. She is happy with the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to boost her motorcycle business by purchasing another motorcycle.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice in Likoni. In addition, she also operates a timber-selling business which is her other source of income. Roselyn requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy additional sacks of rice and timber to sell. Roselyn has been in this business for six years now. In the future, Roselyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell and timber for resale.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick, 32 years old, is from Kisumu City, situated in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Cecilia, who works in an office in town, and they have two children, aged 13 and 7 years.

For the last 8 years, Fredrick has operated a business locally known as Malimali, selling an assorted range of household products. He makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. Fredrick is now taking out his fifth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy calculators, power extension cables, flashlights and other items for sale. He will use the profits to educate his children. Fredrick's dream is to have a big business.

loans.use: To buy calculators, power extension cables, flashlights and other items.

loans.name: Javlyanbek

texts.ru: Джавлянбек женат и ответственный отец двоих детей. Уже много лет он работает мясником, имеет ларек на центральном рынке города. Джавлянбек всегда продает свежее мясо, имеет много постоянных клиентов. Раньше занимался предоставлением услуги транспорта и до сих пор занимается такси бизнесом в свободное время. Дополнительно занимается скотоводством. Эти бизнесы приносят ему хороший доход и он хочет расширить их, чтобы стать успешным бизнесменом. Джавлянбек хотел бы получить займ для покупки скота для бойни с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту. Джавлянбек заранее благодарен вам за вашу щедрость.
texts.en:
Javlyanbek is married and the responsible father of two children.  He has been working as a butcher for many years and has a stall at the central market in town.  He always sells fresh meat and has a large number of regular customers.  

In the past, Javlyanbek used to provide transportation services and he still works in the taxi business in his spare time.  He is also involved in animal husbandry.

Javlyanbek makes a good income thanks to his professional activities.  He would like to expand his businesses in order to become a successful businessman.  

Javlyanbek would like to receive a loan to buy cattle for slaughter in order to expand his [butcher shop] business.  He looks forward to your help and kindness and thanks you in advance for your generosity.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат 1986 года рождения.Он недавно женился, детей у него пока нет.Он молодой предприниматель, 6 лет назад его отец предложил ему совместно разводить скот. Теперь когда он уже подрос и умеет ухаживать за скотом самостоятельно имеет неплохой доход от продажи скота. Его отец полностью передал ему бизнес, а сам торгует в магазине продуктами  питания. Шухрату нравиться ухаживать за скотом, каждые 5-6 месяцев он перепродает скот на местном рынке. У него есть определенные клиенты которые покупают из дому овец.Наступает национальный таджикский праздник Рамадан, и Шухрат планирует увеличить поголовье скота и продать в праздничные дни по выгодной цене.На полученный кредит он планирует увеличить поголовье  скота.
texts.en: Shuhrat was born 1986.  He recently got married and does not yet have children.  He is a young entrepreneur, and his father offered him to breed livestock together six years ago.  Now that he grew up and can take of livestock independently, he has a good income from selling livestock.  His father transferred the business to him completely and sells food products at a store.  Shuhrat likes to take care of livestock.  He resells livestock at a local market every 5-6 months.  He has set clients, who purchase sheep from him at home.  The Tajik national holiday, Ramadan, is approaching, and Shuhrat plans to increase the livestock headcount and sell livestock during the celebrations at an advantageous price.  He plans to increase his livestock headcount with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hamrobibi

texts.ru: Хамробиби трудолюбивая и честная женщина, она разведена и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Недавно она начала свой бизнес. Она занимается купле- продажей тканей в розницу, а также продает одежду и продовольственные товары. Она в этом бизнесе около 5 месяцев. На накопленный капитал она открыла свой бизнес и старается развивать и расширить его. Она также является швеей, она шьет и продает одежду. Так как у Хамробиби бизнес открылся недавно,  с этой целью она запрашивает займ для покупки товара с целью расширения бизнеса и пополнения оборотного капитала. Она надеется, что вы позволите ей расширять бизнес и стать успешной.
texts.en: Hamrobibi is an honest and hard-working person. She is divorced and raising two children. Recently she launched her own business. She buys and resells fabric, as well as clothing and groceries. She has been doing it for over five months. She used the accumulated savings to open her business and attempts to develop and expand it. She is also a seamstress and sews clothing for sale. Since her business has not been in existence for a long time, she is requesting a loan to expand her business and increasing of working capital. She hopes that you will allow her to expand her business and become successful.

loans.use: To purchase of merchandise in order to expand her business

loans.name: Blanca Berta

texts.es:
Blanca, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para poder fortalecer el negocio, comprara una variedad de recuerdos para la venta, como tazas de porcelana, copas plásticas, imágenes, listones, maya, pega, entre otros que son necesarios para poder decorar.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le sirvió para pode mejorar el negocio, fortaleciéndolo de mejores productos decorados, esto le ha permitido tener mejor aceptación con sus clientes y mejorar tambien sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Blanca is requesting a new loan in order to strengthen her business. She will buy a variety of keepsakes to sell, such as porcelain cups, plastic containers, images, ribbons, Mayan mementos and glue, among other items that are necessary for decorating.

She states that her former loan helped her improve her business by strengthening it with products that were better decorated. This has allowed her to be better received by her customers and has also improved her profits.

loans.use: to purchase porcelain cups, plastic containers, images, ribbons, Mayan mementos and glue.

loans.name: Vali

texts.ru: Вали трудолюбивый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Дети еще маленькие, старшему 6 лет, среднему 3 года, а младшему 1 год. Условия жизни у них были тяжелые. Его отец в 2000 году организовал  дехканское хозяйство, которое составляет 350 гектаров земли, в течении 3-х лет деятельности он понес большие убытки так как погодные условия были сложными. Пришлось им разделить землю между другими членами хозяйства и на девять частей, ему досталась 19 гектаров. Средство для посева и сбора урожая не было, он запланировал поездку  в Россию, чтобы заработать деньги, но внезапно он заболел и долгое время пролежал в больнице. Когда он выздоровел уехал в Россию, где проработал 2 года. Приехав на Родину с деньгами он опять начал заниматься откормом скота и выращиванием сельхозкультур. В основном он выращивает пшеницу, кукурузу, горох и другие сельхозпродукты. Уже более 3-х лет он занимается этим бизнесом. Его заботливая жена и отец помогают ему в ведении бизнеса. Полученный урожай он продает местным жителям по более низкой цене чем на базаре, с первых рук. Большая часть населения данного района приобретают сельхлозпродукты у него. Вали хотел бы получить займ для приобретения семян, горюче-смазочных материалов и скот для увлечения поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Vali is a hardworking man.  He is married and raises three children who are still quite young (the oldest is 6, the second is 3 and the youngest is 1 year old).

Vali and his family have had difficult life circumstances.  In 2000, Vali's father started a private farm on 350 hectares of land.  Within three years of operation they suffered great losses due to difficult weather conditions.  As a result, they had to divide the land among members of the farming business and into nine parts.  Vali's family ended up with 19 hectares of land. 

As they didn't have the necessary means to plant and harvest, Vali planned a trip to Russia to earn some money.  However, he suddenly fell ill and had to stay in a hospital  for a long time.  Having recovered, he went to Russia, where he worked for two years.  When he came back home with some money, he once again started to get involved in cattle fattening and crop cultivation.  

He now mainly grows wheat, corn, peas and other agricultural products and has been involved in this activity for more than three years.  His caring wife and his father help him with the business.  He sells harvested crops directly to the local residents at a much lower price than what can be bought at the market.

A large number of the residents of this district buy their produce from him.

Vali would like to get a loan to buy seeds, fuel and lubricants.  With the rest of the money, he would also like to purchase livestock to increase his herd.

loans.use: to buy seeds, cattle, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Buukan

texts.ru: Буукан 30 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Буукан на протяжении 5 лет занимается разведением скота, служащим  основным источником дохода для ее семьи. Начав этот бизнес с суммы 15,000 сом, использованную на покупку 1 головы рогатого скота, на сегодняшний  день  Буукан  имеет в хозяйстве уже 4  коровы. Ежемесячный доход от хозяйства составляет сумму около 10,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Буукан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Буукан планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Buukan is 30 years old, married and raising three children.  She has been involved in breeding livestock for five years - a business that provides the primary source of income for her family.  Having started this business with a sum of 15,000 som, used to purchase one cow, today Buukan's business already contains four cows.  The monthly income from the business amounts to about 10,000 som.  In order to further develop her business, Buukan requested a loan in the amount of 90,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge es soltero, tiene 25 años, comenta que se dedica a la olería, ya que tiene su propia fábrica de ladrillos, en la cual trabaja desde los 18 años.
 Jorge es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ya que empieza su trabajo todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día y termina ya entrada la noche. Cuenta que con mucho sacrificio está saliendo adelante y le gusta lo que hace, y es por ello que le gustaría poder seguir trabajando en este negocio.
El comenta que algún día quiere tener una familia y darles, por medio de su trabajo lo que necesitan. Jorge solicita el crédito para la compra de una mezcladora que desea utilizar en su olería y de esa forma poder mejorar el servicio que da a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jorge is 25 years old and single.  He makes bricks for a living and has his own brick factory, where he has worked since he was 18.

Jorge is a very hardworking and enterprising man.  He begins his work very early every morning and finishes late at night.  After much sacrifice he is getting ahead, and he enjoys what he does, and that is why he wants to keep working in this business. 

Jorge says that he wants to have a family someday, and he would like to provide them what they need through his work.  He is asking for a loan so he can purchase a mixer to use in his factory, which will help him improve the service he provides to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase a mixer for making bricks.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en: Tahmina is a young woman with more than 4 years experience in business. She has very interesting kind of business deal. Tahmina doesn’t sells clothing or fruits and vegetables, she sells different spare part of bicycle and other things for household goods. She has own selling place in market. Tahmina doesn’t married and lives with parents. Her parents are glad that have a daughter as Tahmina because she is beautiful, smart, kind and perfect business lady. Tahmina would like to get a loan for purchasing of spare parts for bicycles in order to refill her working capital. She hopes to your support and kindness.

loans.use: To buy spare parts of bicycles to expand business

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique tiene 50 años, es un hombre responsable y muy trabajador. Vive solo en su casa propia, la misma que pudo obtenerla gracias al esmero que pone día a día en sus actividades laborales. Actualmente está separado de quien fue su esposa por muchos años, fruto de su matrimonio tiene tres hijos, dos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y se encarga solo de la menor de ellos, de 17 años. Por ella se esfuerza para poder brindarle lo necesario para sus estudios y para obtener su carrera profesional.

La principal fuente de ingresos es la construcción, su mano de obra es muy solicitada entre las personas que conocen de su trabajo y lo buscan para contribuir en la edificación de algún proyecto. Su experiencia en esta actividad es su principal carta de presentación, ya que conoce a detalle todas las pautas necesarias que se exigen en una obra de construcción. Dependiendo de la magnitud puede trabajar solo o acompañado de un grupo de personas que el mismo se encarga de seleccionar, depende también de la urgencia que su cliente le exija. En cada uno de los trabajos que ha realizado se esfuerza por dar lo mejor de sí, buscando en todo momento la tranquilidad y confortabilidad de sus clientes. Lleva desarrollando este oficio hace 15 años y le va muy bien. Por otro lado, eventualmente se dedica a manejar su mocarro haciendo servicio de taxi, y por si fuera poco también pretende construir algunas habitaciones en su terreno para alquilarlas, con todo ello busca mejorar su nivel de vida.
Disfruta mucho de trabajar en la construcción, sabe que con ese trabajo pudo brindar lo necesario a su familia por muchos años; lo complicado es cargar las bolsas pesadas de cemento y manipular las mezclas con sus propias manos, ya que le producen ardor en los dedos y el envejecimiento de la piel. Es por eso que espera trabajar un tiempo más en esta actividad, ahorrar lo suficiente e invertir en el alquiler de habitaciones.

Este es el crédito número 10 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometido, una vez más, en cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 500) desea renovar algunas herramientas para mejorar su trabajo. También desea comprar madera y calaminas para construir su primera habitación para alquiler.
texts.en:
Enrique is 50 years old.  He is a very hard-working and responsible man.  He lives alone in his own home that he was able to obtain thanks to the care that he puts into his work every day.  Enrique is currently separated from his wife of many years.  As a result of his marriage, he has three children.  Two of his children are already adults and he is only responsible for the youngest (a girl), who is 17 years old.  For this daughter, he works hard so that he can provide her with an education and help her obtain a degree.

Enrique's main source of income is the construction trade.  His labor is very much in demand among people who know his work and they seek him out to build their projects for them.  His experience in this trade is his main calling card since he knows all the stages of a building job off by heart.  Depending on the scale of a job, he can either work alone or together with a group of people who he selects himself.  This all depends on the urgency expressed by his customers.  On every job that he does, Enrique insists on providing the very best of himself.  He always seeks to make his customers happy and comfortable.  He has been in this business for 15 years and is doing very well.  On a casual basis, he also provides a taxi service.  As if this weren't enough, he has also built some rooms on his land in order to rent them out.  This is all done in order to improve his quality of life.

Enrique really enjoys working in the building trade.  He knows that, through this work, he is able to provide for his family.  His most difficult task is dealing with the heavy bags of cement and manipulating the mixtures with his own hands because it hurts his fingers and ages his skin.  For this reason, he hopes to work just a short while longer in this business before he is able to save up enough to invest in renting out rooms.

This is Enrique's 10th loan from MFP and he is grateful to those who are making his loan possible so that he can continue meeting his goals.  He is very committed, once again, to making his repayments on time as he did with his previous loans.  He is very happy to be a member of his community bank because all of the members are very good, kind, supportive people.

Enrique would like to use the 500 soles he has requested to replace some of his tools so that he can improve his work.  He would also like to buy wood and metal sheets so that he can build his first room to rent out.

loans.use: to renew some of his work tools

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
El Sr. Cecilio se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, y es gracias a su trabajo que pudo juntar un dinero y hoy quiere abrir una tienda de comestibles y venta de bebidas de todo tipo. Su meta es crecer y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia a tener una vida digna y sin privaciones.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, jamón, queso, hortalizas, y demás insumos para los comestibles, y también para la compra de bebidas para surtir su negocio. El agradece por la ayuda que recibe de kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Cecilio makes a living selling household appliances.  Thanks to his hard work, he was able to save money and now wants to open a grocery store.  His goal is to grow the business and continue to support his family, and to have a good life without hardship.

He is asking for a loan to purchase meat, ham, cheese, vegetables, beverages, and other supplies to stock his business.  He is thankful for the help that he receives from Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to purchase meat, ham, cheese, vegetables, and beverages.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario es de la ciudad de Santaní,  es soltero. Y nos cuenta que es dueño de una gomería con 13 años de funcionamiento, tiene buenísima ubicación y con clientela formada, también vende cubiertas nuevas y usadas.
Mario es un señor muy trabajador y muy responsable, que siempre se esfuerza por poder cumplir con todos los pedidos de sus clientes, y que salgan satisfechos de su local. El mismo nos comenta que gracias a los créditos que el cliente recibió de la Fundación, su negocio está creciendo cada día más y está muy agradecido por ello.
Nuevamente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio, ya que necesita comprar cubiertas y también algunas herramientas para su taller, para poder seguir dando un buen  servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mario is single and from the city of Santaní.  He tells us that he has owned a tire repair shop for 13 years.  His business is in a good location and he has an established customer base.  He sells new and used tires.

Mario is a very hard-working and responsible man who always works as hard as he can in order to fill his customers' orders and ensure they leave his premises satisfied.  He tells us that, thanks to his loans from Fundación Paraguaya, his business continues to grow and he is very grateful as a result.

Mario is requesting a new loan to invest in his business as he needs to buy tires and some tools for his workshop.  In this way, he will be able to continue providing his customers with a good service.

loans.use: to buy tires and some tools for his workshop

loans.name: Abed El Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 62 years old, married, and has three children.

Abed El Hasan has a shop for different types of gadgets. He established his business in 2008. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of the local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation, and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $1500 to install shelves in his shop. He aims to gain more profits, which will offer better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To install shelves in his shop

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is a widow. She has three children with ages ranging from 29 years to 48 years. She describes herself to be philanthropic. She operates a food stall where she sells bananas and avocados. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located at an ideal location, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of avocados and bananas. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more avocados and bananas to sell. Her business goal is to run a fully stocked food stall within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy avocados and bananas

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en: Celeste is a 21-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has no children yet and hopes to have one soon. Celeste and her husband are both involved in fishing. She sells her husband's catch at their town's market. She also processes salted and dried fish. Celeste does her best to increase their income. She applied for a loan to purchase a fishing boat. This will help bring in more fish for Celeste and her husband to sell. Celeste hopes to acquire more fishing boats in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Adela Zamudio - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ADELA ZAMUDIO está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Ana , vive por la zona  de Sopocachi, La Sra. Ana en la foto esta de chompa blanca a lado del Sr. Pablo, la Sra. Ana se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, fideo, arroz y azúcar en su tienda de barrio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ana va a usar este préstamo para compra de abarrotes por mayor como fideo, arroz y azúcar y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir ampliando su  negocio, la Sra.  Ana va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una amplia gama de productos de primera necesidad. La Sra. Ana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The ADELA ZAMUDIO Entrepreneurship Bank is composed of eight members, seven women and one man. The president of the bank is Sra. Ana, who lives in the Sopocachi area. 

Sra. Ana is in the photo wearing a white sweater, seated next to Sr. Pablo. She sells basic supplies, such as groceries, noodles, rice and sugar in her neighborhood store. This loan is her first with Emprender. She is going to use it to purchase groceries wholesale, such as noodles, rice and sugar and thus increase her working capital. The reason she is applying for this loan is to continue stocking her business. She will use the income to continue buying merchandise and thus improving her income. Her wish for her business is to have a broad range of basic supplies. She is a very hardworking person and is happy for the opportunity being provided to her. Members of the group, in some cases, are the sole breadwinners of their families.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as groceries, sugar and sweets to stock her store.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno, a married mother of five children, lives in Samburu, Kenya and has been selling goat meat at the market to butcher shop operators for five years. With a small amount of capital, she started buying goats to raise in her yard, fattening and then selling them. She is supported in this business by her husband.

Luvuno's business has gradually grown, and now her main customers are not only neighbours but also restaurants and businesses that sell special meals. This has helped her business growth as customers always refer new buyers to her.

Luvuno's main challenge is having enough working capital to buy more goats for resale to increase her income, which her family depends upon. For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more goats.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha lives in the town of Samburu with her husband and one child, who is 17 years old and still attends school. She is a hair dresser and operates a beauty salon from her home. She started her business four years ago. Asha and her husband are very determined to succeed in order to give their child a better quality of life and help their child become successful. Asha is asking for a Kiva loan, which is her first loan with field partner Yehu Microfinance Trust, in order to buy chemicals, braids, and make-up kits.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, braids, and make-up kits

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is married and lives in Samburu with her husband. Peninah's business is selling goats for meat at the market to butcher shop operators. She started her business five years ago with a small amount of capital. She started buying goats to raise in her yard, fattening them and selling them. She is supported in this business by her husband.

Peninah's business has gradually grown, and now her main customers are not only neighbors, but also restaurants and businesses that sell special meals. This helps her business' growth, as they always refer new buyers to her. Peninah's main challenge is having enough working capital to buy more goats to sell to increase her income. For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan to buy goats to sell. This will help increase her income, which her family depends upon.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para poderse comprar mercadería nueva, blusas, lencería, pantalones jeans,  y otras prendas que son necesarias para poder ofrecer a la clientela, ya que esto le ayudara a tener una ingreso adicional, y mantener su preferencia, aprovechado que en varias zonas la conocen.
Con el préstamo anterior ella tuvo una buena experiencia, ya que logro realizar una buena compra de pan, incremento el negocio y hasta el momento ha podido hacerle frente a sus obligaciones en el hogar.
texts.en:
Blanca is seeking a new loan to buy blouses, underwear, jeans, and other new merchandise to offer her customers. This will help her obtain additional income and maintain the level of satisfaction of her customers in the various areas in which she works.

With the previous loan Blanca had a good experience as she managed to buy bread at good prices, expand her business, and still fulfill all her household obligations.

loans.use: to buy blouses, underwear, and jeans

loans.name: Boi

texts.en:
Boi is 48 years old and married. She has four children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

She and her husband have earned money by making cakes at their house for 15 years. She would like to take a loan to increase her production of cakes by buying good quality flour and ingredients. This will help her to satify her current customers and attract new customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and helps her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy good quality ingredients to make cakes.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines and earns additional income from operating a rice mill. Luz is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her prior loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Elber

texts.es:
El Sr. Elber es de la ciudad de Santaní,, tiene 28 años, es soltero. El comenta que tiene un automóvil en el cual trabaja como taxi de pasajeros.
El es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante y progresar. Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran parada de taxis, y de esa forma poder dar trabajo a otras personas también. El comenta que algún día quiere formar su familia y también tener hijos.
Elber solicita el crédito para poder arreglar la chapería de su taxi, y de esa forma poder darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elber is from the city of Santaní. He is 28 and single. He says that he has a car that he uses as a passenger taxi. He is a very hard-working person with a strong desire to succeed and move forward in life. 

His greatest dream is to be able to have a large taxi company and that way provide work to other people too. He says that someday he wants to start a family and have children.

Elber is requesting the loan in order to have body repair work done on his taxi. This is so that he can provide a better service to his customers.

loans.use: To have body repair work done on his taxi.

loans.name: Lilian Jeannette

texts.es:
Lilian, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que considera son una buena alternativa para el crecimiento de su negocio, se comprara short, jeans, blusas, ropa interior, con nuevos estilos, para mantener la preferencia de los clientes, esta inversión le permitirá crecer en su inventario, teniendo mayor disponibilidad.
Ella manifiesta haber tenido una experiencia positiva, de la que aumentaron sus ganancias y ha mejorado el negocio, hasta el momento no ha enfrentado ningún inconveniente en su familia al igual que en el negocio.
texts.en:
Lilian is seeking another loan to buy shorts, jeans, blouses, and underwear in new styles to maintain the level of satisfaction of her customers. She sees the addition of these items as a way to grow her business. Her inventory will increase and she will have more stock available for her customers.

Lilian says she has had a positive experience, income has increased, and she has improved her business. Currently she has no problems with either her family or her business.

loans.use: to buy shorts, jeans, blouses, and underwear

loans.name: Esau

texts.en:
Esau is 26 years old and married to Lydia. They have a one-year-old child. He runs a snack shop business that earns him a monthly income of KES. 12,000. He has been in operation for nine years now.

After successfully completing his previous two loans from KADET LTD, he has applied for his third loan of KES 30,000. He will use the loan to purchase ten bales of baking flour and cooking oil for snacks production and resale. With the anticipated profits from the business, he plans to provide for the basic needs of his family. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to manage his snack shop effectively to attain maximum profits and to be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Dorgham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 21 years old, single and lives with his family.

Dorgham works in the upholstery field. He also has a machine for refurbishing wool. He has worked in this business since 2005. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3000 loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 40, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a turner. She supports her family by sewing clothes at her house. She started this job to cover her expenses and raise her two children. 

Anh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying sewing materials so that she will be able to increase her production and the turnover of her business. She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Ledis Esther

texts.es: Ledis es una mujer de 34 años que presta servicios de corte, tratamientos capilares, cepillados, colorimetría, entre otros, en su salón de belleza ubicada en el barrio Las Nieves de Barranquilla. Solicita su primer crédikiva con para comprar una silla de peluquería, un tocador y un gabetero para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  A Ledis siempre le llamó la atención todo lo relacionado con la belleza, es por esto que hace 4 años decidió hacer un curso de peluquería donde aprendió muchas cosas del oficio. Una vez lo terminó empezó a hacer peinados a domicilio con lo que poco a poco se dio a conocer y a adquirir su clientela.  Pero Ledis quería establecerse en un lugar fijo donde tuviera todos los implementos para prestar el servicio, por esto recurrió a un crédito con una entidad financiera con el que compró lo básico para montar su negocio en la casa. Sus clientes son los vecinos del sector, aunque todavía atiende a domicilio a quien lo requiera.  Compra de contado los materiales que utiliza, semanalmente en distribuidoras del centro de la ciudad.  Su principal sueño es tener un local amplio bien dotado con todos los enseres, aparte de su vivienda.  Vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, a los cuales desea formar y ver crecer con las mejores condiciones, es por esto que día a día se esmera por atender bien a sus clientes para así aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ledis is a 34 year old woman who offers hair cutting, hair treatments, waxing and coloring, among other services, at her beauty salon located in Las Nieves de Barranquilla neighborhood. She is requesting her first Kiva loan in order to buy a hairdresser’s chair, a dressing table and a cabinet to offer better service to her customers. 

Ledis has always been attracted by anything related to beauty. For this reason she decided to take a course in hairdressing four years ago where she learned much about the profession. Once she finished, she started doing hair at people’s homes and gradually became known and acquired customers. However Ledis wanted to have a fixed location where she would have all the equipment needed to provide her services.  Thus she applied for a loan with a financial institution and with it bought the basics needed to start her business at home. Her customers are her neighbors in the area, although she will still go out to someone’s home when it is required. 

Ledis pays cash weekly for the materials that she uses and buys from distributors in the city center. Her principal dream is to have a large place, well supplied with all the equipment needed, separate from her home.

She lives in a common law relationship and has three minor children. She wants to see them educated and grow up under the best conditions. That is why she does her best for her customers, so that she can increase her sales and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase a hairdresser's chair, a dressing table and a cabinet.

loans.name: Otieno

texts.en:
William is a 29 year old married man. He has three children ranging from six months to seven years. He describes himself to be very industrious.

He operates a vehicle ans provides transportation services.  William has been in business for four years and employs two staff members. His business is located within town and his primary customers are passengers.  He biggest business challenge is the high prices of fuel. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to pay to service his car.  He hopes that in the future, he will be able to provide for his family financially.

loans.use: to pay for the servicing of the car.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 43 year-old married man and father of one child.  He has been selling toys, gifts and souvenirs for nine years.  Khalil also sells prepaid mobile phones card, which helps him improve his income.

Khalil applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy special products and new releases.  This is Khalil's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower.  His first loan helped him improve his business, and it reflected positively on both his social and financial situations.

He is working hard to expand his business as much as he can, and hopes to open a new shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy special products and new releases.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 55-year-old married man. He has eight children with ages ranging from 11 to 25 years old. He describes himself to be a humble man. He operates a farm where he sells maize, beans, pawpaw and mangoes. He has been involved in this business for 30 years and employs two staff members. His business is located along a busy road and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be unconducive weather changes. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a sprinkler and fertilizer. His business goal is to expand his farming and become a supplier of maize, bananas etc within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a sprinkler and fertilizer.

loans.name: Diva

texts.es:
Diva tiene 28 años, es una mujer alegre y con deseos de superación, además de amable y cordial. Su pareja es Eber, quien es empleado en una empresa de su localidad. La casa donde viven en propia, la cual construyó con mucho esfuerzo. Aun no tienen hijos.

La actividad que realiza es la costura, oficio que aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional. Compró una máquina de coser, con sus ahorros, y la instaló en su vivienda, que es donde atiende a sus clientes, quienes la buscan por los buenos acabados que realiza. Por ello ha logrado ganar su aceptación y la recomiendan con otras personas. Se inicio hace más de 6 meses en este negocio y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola. Le gusta su oficio, además que puede apoyar a su pareja en solventar los gastos de su hogar. Pero lo que le incomoda es el cansancio por estar sentada en una misma postura todo el tiempo, lo que le ocasiona dolores de espalda. Pero eso no la desanima y continua trabajando y esforzándose. Por tanto tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y comprarse otras máquinas de coser para poder montar un pequeño taller.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas para tener un buen historial crediticio que le permita el acceso a créditos futuros.
Con el monto solicitado, de 800 nuevos soles, invertirá en arreglar su máquina y con el saldo tiene planeado comprar materiales de costura como tela, hilos y demás.
texts.en:
Dina, 28, is a cheerful, friendly and polite woman with desires to improve herself.  Her partner, Eber, is a worker in a business in the area where they live.  They have their own house which they built with a lot of effort but no children yet.
Diva is a seamstress, a trade that she learned at the occupational education center.  She bought a sewing machine with her savings and set it up in her house.  There she takes care of customers who come to her for the good work that she does.  Because of this, people know about her and she is recommended by others.  Diva started the business 6 months ago and up to this point she has been on her own.  She likes the work, and besides it can help her partner with the household expenses.  What she doesn't like is how tired she gets by sitting in the same position all the time-this gives her pains in her back.  But it doesn't depress her and she continues working and making the effort.  She has plans of expanding her business and buying other sewing machines so that she can set up a small workshop.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make the payments on time so she will have a good credit history that will allow her more financing in the future.
She will use the requested 800 new sols to fix her machine and  the balance to buy materials such as fabric, thread and more

loans.use: to fix her sewing machine and buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana lives with her husband and their three children at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  She has operated a retail shop (a small store that carries a wide variety of goods) where she sells her household products, bundles of wheat flour, sugar and rice. She started her business as a way to contribute to the household income. 

Her greatest challenge is that she does not have enough working capital to respond to the demand in a growing market. Luciana needs to be prepared for these times by having inventory in her display cases to impact her market and to have good sales.

This is exactly the reason that she turned to her Kiva loan, her first loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust. Luciana will use her loan to buy merchandise, especially household items of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 34-year-old widow from Kisumu City, which is situated in the Western part of Kenya. She is currently taking care of her three children who are nine, six and three years old.

Pamela sells shoes, a business she has been doing for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES 8,000. She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more shoes and sandals. She will use the profits to educate her children.
 
Her dream is to have a big shoe shop in Kisumu.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and sandals to sell

loans.name: Aracelis

texts.es:
Con 29,400 pesos Aracelis quiere terminar de construir y decorar el local de su salón de belleza, además de comprar más productos para ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Aracelis es casada, su esposo es barbero y tienen un bebé de 3 meses. 
El deseo de Aracelis es cada día perfeccionarse en las técnicas de peluquería para poder atender a una mayor variedad de clientes y diversificar su negocio instalando una tienda de ropa para servir a los clientes que visitan a su salon de belleza.
texts.en:
Aracelis wants to use 29,400 DOP to buy more products in order to give her customers good service.  In addition to that she wants to finish building and decorating her beauty salon.  

Aracelis is married, and her husband is a barber.  They have a three month old baby.

Aracelis’s wish is to continually improve her hairdressing techniques in order to be able to tend to a greater variety of customers.  She wants to diversify her business by setting up a clothing store for the customers who come to her beauty salon.

loans.use: to improve her place of business and to buy inventory.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 45-year-old man from Kisumu City, which is situated in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Margaret who is also a business lady and they have six children between 10 and 18 years old.


Paul sells shoes in Kisumu and has been in this business for the last two years. He makes a monthly income of KES 8,000. He is taking his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more shoes and sandals to sell. Paul intends to use his profits to add more stock of shoes to sell in the business. 

His dream is to have a big business.

loans.use: To buy shoes and sandals to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is thirty eight years old and married with four children.  She sells clothes by hawking and has been in business for two years  She earns a monthly income of KES. 8,000. 

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use it to purchase more clothes.  She intends to use the profit from the business to open a boutique.  Rose hopes to be a prosperous business lady.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Jhim

texts.es:
Jhim tiene 34 años, es un hombre trabajador, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Jenny, la madre de sus tres hijos: Jhim de 15 años, Brayan de 6 años y Génesis de 10 meses de nacido. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, donde también le han dado alojamiento temporal a su cuñado.

Su negocio es el alquiler de su motocarro, el cual adquirió hace 15 años con sus ahorros y los de su pareja. Lo alquilan a una persona responsable que le paga por día trabajado. También cuenta con un empleo en una empresa privada, y en ocasiones el mismo sale a manejar su motocarro haciendo el servicio de taxi, teniendo de esa manera varios ingresos económicos. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene este tipo de servicio en su zona. Se decidió por este negocio por el deseo de contar con sus propios ingresos económicos y para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Este es el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP y está agradecido al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero para avanzar. Por otro lado, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, junto con sus ahorros, invertirá en la compra de otro motocarro de segundo uso, valorizado en 2000 nuevos soles. También adquirirá repuestos para moto y dará mantenimiento a su actual vehículo.
texts.en:
34-year old Jhim is a hardworking man with a great desire to get ahead in life. He and his wife Jenny have three children: Jhim (15 years), Brayan (6), and Génesis (10 months). They live in their own home together with his brother-in-law who is staying with them temporarily.

Jhim earns his living in several different ways. He rents out the motorcycle he bought 15 years ago with his own and his wife’s savings. It is rented to a responsible person who pays for it on a daily basis. Jhim also has a job with a private company, and as well sometimes drives the vehicle himself and uses it as a taxi. He believes the business is a good one as it brings in money and is much in demand in the area. He decided to start this business as he wanted to have an income of his own and provide his family with a better standard of living.

This will be Jhim’s 4th loan with MFP, and he is happy in the knowledge that he can count on this financial support. He also notes that he is pleased with his community bank because he knows the other members well and considers them responsible people.

With the S/. 1500 loan and his own savings he plans to buy another secondhand motorcycle worth S/. 2000. He will also buy spare parts and service his current vehicle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle and service his current one

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
She began her life as a merchant four years ago with the goal of working on her own and contributing to the support of her household. With very little education, she thought that gradually it would become an option for self-employment that would allow her to get ahead and achieve growth for herself and her family. Her long-term goal is to educate her children so they become successful and happy people.

Currently she plans to grow gradually. This is why she is coming for a Kiva loan, her second financing from Yehu Microfinance Trust. With the loan, she plans to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice. Her investment will be successful because it is based on market demand and on her vast business experience.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Giao

texts.en:
Giao is 36 years old and single. She earns a living by sewing clothes at her house.  She started her business 18 years ago to generate enough income to cover her expenses.  She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Giao is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying an over-locking machine, better quality materials and fabric to meet demands of her customers.  She hopes to attract more customers.  Giao hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an over-locking machine, better quality materials and fabric to meet demands of her customers.

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en:
This is Elvera.  She previously had a loan that she used buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings.  Her earnings were a big help in terms of paying to educate her children and to cover household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 30,000 loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Elvera dreams to be able to give her children a high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Andres Hungria

texts.es:
Con 31,500 pesos Andres podrá volver a construir el local de su fábrica de dulce de leche que se le quemó hace tres meses. Actualmente Andres está produciendo sus dulces en una casucha improvisada, pero no puede tener ni el volumen de producción ni el nivel de higuiene al que está acostmbrado.
Andrés es casado, su esposa es ama de casa y tienen tres hijos adultos que ya no viven con ellos.
El sueño de andres es volver a tener un lugar amplio y cómodo donde producir sus dulces de leche y poder servir a la cantidad de clientes que esperan su producto. El no vende directamente al público, sino que distribuye sus dulces a bodegas (grocey stores, convenience stores).Por la falta de espacio,en este momento solo puede abastecer a la mitad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
With 31,500 DOP Andrés will be able to rebuild his place of business, a “dulce de leche” [a sweet prepared with milk and carmalized sugar] factory, which burned down three months ago.  

Andrés is currently making his sweets in an improvised shanty.  However, he is not able to have the volume of production  or the hygiene to which he has been accustomed.

Andrés is married, and his wife is a housewife.  They have three adult children who no longer live with them.

Andrés’s dream is to once again have a large and comfortable place to produce his dulces de leche.  Then he would be able to tend to the quantity of customers that are waiting for his product.

He does not sell directly to the public.  He distributes his sweets to grocery stores and convenience stores.  Due to the lack of space at this time, he is only able to supply half of his customers.

loans.use: to rebuild his sweets factory.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 28 years man from Kisumu City, situated in the Western part of Kenya.  He is married to Risper who is in college and they have two children, ages seven and three years.

Lawrence sells an assortment of household products (a business locally known as Malimali).  Hhe has been in business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000. 

He is applying for a second loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD to buy torches, key holders, children toys, men's socks and other items.  He will use his profits to increase his stock.  Lawrence's dream is to have a big business.

loans.use: to buy torches, key holders, children toys, men's socks and other items.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has three children and lives in Samburu, Kenya.  She generates her income by selling fresh vegetables, tomatoes, fruits and onions.

She started her business approximately two years.  As a mother and head of household, her biggest challenge is to meet the needs of her children until she achieves her dream of seeing them become successful people; they are the impetus for her to ongoing work. 

Her joy and dynamism helps her succeed in her business, but she needs to increase her business capital to achieve her goal of generating more income. 

This is why Mary is requesting her first Kiva loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust which will buy merchandise like green vegetables, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes for resale.  She needs disposable income to stock up on more products and to offer her clients more products. This will result in the success of her investment and will be the advancement she needs to be able to achieve her dreams in the future.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline lives with her two children ages 8 and 13 in Samburu, Kenya.  There she sell household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.  She also sells farm produce like green vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes. 

Her goal is to have a wholesale outlet and a warehouse to distribute to other vendors.  Right now, she is applying for a micro-loan, the first financial loan she's made with the Yehu Microfinance Trust, to buy wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice for resale.  She intends to use these products to widen her clientele and make greater sales.  

As this happens, her dream is to supply cereals in bulk to local markets to help guarantee a successful future for her children.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 37 year old married man.  He has 5 children ranging from 1 year to 15 years old.  He describes himself as honest.  He operates a retail store where he sells plastic items such as bowls, mugs, containers etc.  He has been in business for 3 years and employs one staff member. 

His business is located along a busy town and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business.  He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more plastics items to sell. 

His business goal is to run a wholesale supermarket within 5 years.  Vincent hopes that in the future, he will be happy in his life as that he will have fulfilled his dream.

loans.use: to buy plastic items.

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
Con 13,780 pesos Rosa podrá comprar más tela y materiales para poder atender a tiempo los pedidos de sus clientes. A veces los clientes de Rosa le hacen pedidos que no puede suplir y pierde al cliente por no tener el material suficiente para confeccionar la ropa a tiempo.
Rosa es casada, su esposo es vendedor ambulante y tienen dos hijos de 5 y tres años. Ya el de 5 años inició la escuela y Rosa y su familia estan muy felices al saber que pueden darle una educacion a sus hijos.
En el futuro a Rosa le gustaría sacar el taller a un local fuera de su casa y le pide a Dios que le de los recursos y fuerzas necesarias para poder enviar a sus hijos a la universidad.
texts.en:
With 13,780 DOP Rosa will be able to buy more fabric and materials.  She will do this in order to take care of her customers’ orders on time.

At times Rosa’s customers place orders with her that she is not able to fill.  Then she loses the customer because she does not have enough material to make the clothing on time.

Rosa is married, and her husband is an itinerant salesman.  They have two children, ages five and three.  The five year old started school, and Rosa and her family are very happy to know that they are able to give their children an education.

In the future Rosa would like to move her shop to a place outside of her home.  She asks God to give her the resources and strength that she needs in order to be able to send her children to the university.

loans.use: to buy materials to make clothes.

loans.name: Dianira

texts.es:
Dianira tiene 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, además de amable y sociable. Está casada con Anderson, el padre de sus 3 hijos: Driver de 13 años, Frank de 8 años y José de 2 años. Juntos, habitan en la casa que su tío le prestó temporalmente, donde también vive su primo.

Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de estructuras de aluminio y vidrio, como vitrinas, ventanas y otros de varios diseños. La venta la realiza desde su vivienda donde tiene un espacio acondicionado para guardar las estructuras. Su esposo es quien se encarga de la elaboración según el pedido del cliente. Se inició hace más de 15 año, contando con un capital propio, y vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades, luego fue aumentando sus ventas por el incremento de la demanda. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, desea continuar e incrementar el stock de sus estantes.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y está contenta y agradecida de saber que cuenta con un apoyo financiero para continuar con sus planes. Además, se siente cómoda y le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales en mayor cantidad para tener un stock disponible; como varillas de aluminio y vidrio para que su esposo siga elaborando las estructuras.
texts.en:
Dianira is 34 years old and is a hard working woman with great desire to get ahead as well as being very nice and sociable.  She is married to Anderson, the father of her three children.  Driver is 13 years old, Frank is 8, and José is two.  Together, they live in the house that her uncle lent them temporarily, where her cousin also lives.

Her business is the making and selling of aluminum and glass structures, like display cabinets, windows, and various other designs.  She makes sales from her home where she has a space arranged to store the structures.  Her husband is the person in charge of putting the structures together according to the requests of the customer.  The business was begun more than 15 years ago, and they started with their own capital, selling in small quantities.  Over time their sales increased due to demand.  For that reason, seeing the good results that they are having, Dianira wants to continue to increase the stock for their shelves.

This is her second loan with the MFP institution, and she is happy and thankful to know that she can count on financial support in order to continue with her plans.  She also feels comfortable and likes the work of her communal bank, since she knows the other group members and considers them responsible people.  

With the amount that she is requesting, 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency), she will invest in the purchase of materials in bulk in order to have stock available, like aluminum bars and glass, so that her husband can continue making the structures.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making the glass and aluminum structures that she sells.

loans.name: Esmeralda Elizeth

texts.es:
Esmeralda, solicita un préstamo, para la compra de leche, queso y cuajada, para la producción, ya que le ayudara para mantener un buen nivel de estos productos y atender la clientela de mejor manera, con un buen inventario, este préstamo será una gran ayuda pues considera que a través de él podrá mejorar su condición en las ventas.
Ella manifiesta haber tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, ya que se le proporciono lo necesario para mantener una buena producción de lácteos, que hasta el momento le ha generado una mejor condición con su familia.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is asking for a loan in order to purchase milk, cheese and curds for the making of various milk and cheese products.  This will help her maintain a good level of these products and better attend to her customers with a good inventory.  This loan will be of great help since she believes that with the loan she will be able to improve her sales.  

She notes that she had a good experience with the previous loan, since it provided what she needed for the good production of cheese, which up to this moment has generated a better condition for her family.

loans.use: To purchase milk, cheese and curds.

loans.name: Plan Director - Cusco Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal PLAN DIRECTOR - CUSCO; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Elizabeth tiene 30 años ,casada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando de lunes a viernes en una institución pública, a la vez la socia es arquitecta de profesión, la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar adelante, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar sus estudios de su maestría.

Los otros socios se dedican a trabajar en una pastelería, administrar un grifo y los demás trabajan en instituciones públicas.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta ,son socios que  pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank Plan Director - Cusco [Project Principal - Cusco]; this bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, in the province and department of Cusco. 

Elizabeth is 30 years old, married with one child. She alternates her daily activities working Monday to Friday in a public institution, and at the same time is an architect by trade. She is a cheerful and responsible person with a strong will to get ahead, which is how she does well by her family. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to pay for her master's studies. 

The other borrowers work in a cake shop, run a filling station, and the rest work in public institutions. 

The borrowers who appear in the separate photos requested permission to arrive late to the meeting, for work reasons. 

Elizabeth appreciates this method of getting a loan, and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to pay for her master's studies.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with three children who are between 4 years and 4 months of age. They live in Samburu, Kenya.

She sells mahamri (dumplings) to support her family. 

Dzame is applying for a Kiva loan to buy wheat flour, cooking fat oil to start a green grocery business, and to buy goods at special wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking fat oil to start a green grocery business and to buy goods at special wholesale prices.

loans.name: Eliu

texts.es:
Eliu tiene 52 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador. Su pareja hace desde hace 30 años es Nancy, de 45 años. Su casa es propia, la misma que pudo construir con el apoyo de su pareja, con mucho esfuerzo e intensas jornadas laborales. Allí viven con su hija menor (tienen cuatro hijos) de 18 años, quien está estudiando su carrera profesional, y es por ella por quien trabaja duramente.

Su trabajo es la venta de abarrotes, verduras y otros artículos de primera necesidad. Tiene una pequeña bodega que ha acondicionado en su vivienda. Todos los días, con ayuda de su pareja, se encarga de atender a los clientes que acuden a comprar los productos necesarios para la preparación de sus alimentos. Su tienda está abierta desde las cinco de la mañana y él se encarga de atender con mucho respeto a cada uno de sus clientes. Tiene este negocio alrededor de 5 años, aunque ha podido avanzar económicamente desde ese entonces, siente que aún no es suficiente, los ingresos que percibe por las ventas no le alcanza para brindarle a su familia una vida digna. Por ese motivo, hace 3 años, dedica parte de su tiempo a trabajar brindando el servicio de vigilancia por las calles de la ciudad, por esa labor recibe cierto monto mensual, lo malo es que tiene que desvelarse algunas horas, pero eso es recompensado por sus vecinos que le demuestran cuanto lo quieren y respetan porque se sienten protegidos. Cuando inició con su tienda tuvo muchas dificultades, pues daba mucho crédito a sus vecinos y luego no le pagaban a tiempo o si lo hacían, no le pagaban la totalidad de su deuda. Con el tiempo ha mejorado y ha aprendido de las experiencias que tuvo.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) comprará más productos para su tienda de abarrotes, ya que desea surtirla con diversidad de productos de distintas marcas.
texts.en:
Eliu is 52 years old, and is a very pleasant and hardworking man.  His partner of 30 years is Nancy, who is 45 years old.  Eliu owns his house, which he and his partner built with much effort and intense work days.  They live with their youngest daughter (they have four children in all) who is 18 and is hard at work studying for her professional career.

Eliu makes a living selling groceries, vegetables, and other basic necessities.  He has a small grocery store that he has set up in his home.  He and his partner work every day attending to customers who come to purchase the products they need for food preparation.  Eliu’s store is open from five in the morning, and he treats each of his customers with great respect.  

Eliu has had this business for about 5 years, and was able to make economic progress during that time; however, he felt that this wasn’t enough, since the income he earned from sales wasn’t sufficient to provide his family with a decent life.  That is why Eliu started working part-time providing a security service on the streets of the city, and he receives a monthly salary for that work.  The bad thing about that job is that he has to stay awake for long hours, but that is more than compensated by his neighbors, who show him how much they appreciate and respect him for making them feel protected. 

When Eliu started out with his store he had many difficulties, since he allowed his neighbors to pay on credit, and then they either didn’t pay him on time or else didn’t pay him the full amount of their debt.  Over time the situation has improved, and Eliu has learned from his experiences.

This is Eliu’s sixth loan with MFP, and he appreciates this opportunity and the confidence that has been placed in him.  He promises to make all of his payments on time.  He is grateful to be part of his communal bank, since he has seen that the other members are responsible and supportive individuals.  Eliu will use the amount he has asked for (1500 soles) to purchase more products for his grocery store, as he wants to stock it with a range of products of different brands.

loans.use: to purchase more products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina tiene 51 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es viuda, sus hijos ya son independientes, pero fue por ellos que se esforzó a pesar de la adversidad. Ahora vive en la casa que compró con el fruto de su trabajo, la acompañan las personas a las que les alquila algunas habitaciones.

Su principal actividad es la venta de hojas secas de “hirapay” que es una palmera amazónica. Estas hojas son usadas para el techado de las casas, las cuales almacena en su vivienda y las vende en la vía pública en un espacio de la vereda. Se inició hace más de 6 meses con un préstamo particular y hasta el momento cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y una persona a la que paga por semana de trabajo. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja. Por otro lado, cuenta que decidió empezar con esta actividad por idea de su socio, quien es el que se encarga de la extracción de estas hojas en montes lejanos. Ahora, viendo los resultados, tiene planes de continuar y aumentar su inversión.

Este es el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, por lo que se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal por considerarlo un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá su totalidad en la extracción de las hojas de hirapay, buscando minimizar gastos y lograr sacar la mayor cantidad posible para tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Celina is 51, and a hard-working, determined woman with a strong desire to suceed. She is a widow, and her children are already independent. But it was for their sake that she did her best in spite of adversity. Now she lives in the house she bought with the fruit of her work. She lives in the company of people that she rents some rooms to. 

Her main livelihood is selling dried "hirapay" leaves (hirapay is an Amazonian palm), that are used for roofing of houses. She stores them in her home and sells them on an area of sidewalk by the highway. 

She started more than six months ago with a private loan, and so far has had the help of her children and of a person she pays on a weekly basis. She considers her business to be quite profitable because of the earnings it provides her. 

Moreover she says that she decided to start this business through her business partner's idea. He is the one who looks after harvesting these leaves in the distant forests. Now, seeing the results, she plans to continue, and to increase her investment.

This is her fifth loan with the MFP institution, so she promises to once more meet her installment payments, as in previous loans she has had. In addition, she feels at ease with her communal bank, as she considers it a close-knit and supportive group.

The entire amount of 1000 nuevos soles applied will be used to harvest hirapay leaves. She is seeking to minimize expenses and get the largest quantity possible, so that she can have greater earnings.

loans.use: To harvest more palm leaves to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (zinc sheets, beams, window frames, etc.).

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
Don Donald, sigue trabajando en seguridad, y como meta es seguir mejorando su casa, para el bien comun de la familia. Sus hijos cursando el año escolar y su esposa ahora tienen un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos, aportando para los gastos del hogar.
Cada día, sigue, haciendo mejoras, hoy con este nuevo préstamo comprara: laminas de zinc, perlines, soldadura para hacer  un bajarete en la parte del fondo del patio, con esto evitara las lluvias y el sol. Así como dar comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Donald is still working in security, and his goal is to keep improving his house for the good of his family. His children attend school during the school year; his wife now has a small business selling clothing and cosmetics and contributes to household expenses. 

Every day he keeps making improvements. Now with the new loan he will buy metal sheeting, beams, and welding to make a porch in the backyard to avoid the rain and sun. This will give comfort to his family.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, beams, and welding to build a porch in back.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr. Daniel de 27 años de edad, está soltero y vive con sus padres, a quien ayuda por medio de su trabajo.    Daniel es técnico en celulares hace más de siete años.
Cuenta que empezó estudiando, y viendo que la necesidad de ese servicio en el lugar  y con el apoyo económico de sus padres, el habilitó para su local de atención a clientes, donde le fue muy bien, y en la actualidad el es muy conocido en la comunidad y con mucha clientela.
Daniel pide este préstamo  para comprar  más accesorios, celulares y repuestos, con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes, ya que tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Sr. Daniel is 27 years old, single and lives with his parents whom he helps through his job. He has been a cell phone technician for seven years. He notes that he began studying and, seeing the need for that service in the area, and with the economic support of his parents, qualified to provide service to customers in his area.
