He has done very well and currently is very well known in the community and has many clients.

Daniel is requesting this loan to purchase more accessories, cell phones and parts with which he will be able to continue working and meeting the demand of his customers since he has many requests.

loans.use: to purchase accessories, cell phones and parts.

loans.name: Isidro Yobani

texts.es:
Isidro, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita del dinero para poder iniciar sus cultivos, comprándose el abono y los herbicidas necesarios para fortalecer la milpa y prevenirlo de las plagas, este préstamo le proporcionara los materiales para aplicarlos ya que su siembra serán dos manzanas de terreno de maíz y una de frijol.
Con el préstamo anterior, Isidro realizo la milpa, de la cual obtuvo una buena producción, en esa ocasión se compro los materiales que le dieron buenos resultados al cultivo.
texts.en:
Isidro is seeking a new loan because he needs the money in order to begin planting his crops, buying the necessary fertilizer and herbicides for strengthening the field and preventing infestations. This loan will supply him the materials for application since he will plant one and a half acres of corn and three quarters of an acre of beans. 

With the previous loan, Isidro produced the crops from which he obtained a good yield. On that occasion he purchased the materials that gave him good results from his planting.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Ganbold, 32, lives with his wife and son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His son is 14 years old and a secondary school student. Ganbold started selling hats at a local marketplace in 2003.  His wife helps with his business. He is a hard-working and humble men.  He currently rents two counters to sell hats. His business is running successfully. His business profit is approximately 750,000 MNT per month. In the winter, many Mongolian households burn coal to warm their houses. Coal usage has been one of the biggest causes for air pollution. Ganbold is building his new house to be warmed by electricity.  He is asking for a loan to buy some necessary building materials to finish his house.  The amount he is requesting is 3,500,000 MNT to buy the necessary materials to finish building his house, which is warmed by electricity.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials to finish building his house, which is warmed by electricity

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 7 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be humble and spiritual. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea, and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 12 years and employs two staff members. Her business is located within a market, and her primary customers are the local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of ingredients. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing meals. Her business goal is to run a five-star hotel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will provide for her family financially.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making food

loans.name: Delfina Elisa

texts.es:
Delfina, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para mejorar el negocio, pues considera necesario la compra de mercadería para el chalet, como lo es las boquitas, gaseosas, jugos, galletas, dulces, y otros comestibles que son demandados por los clientes.
Ella manifiesta haber tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, porque logro realizar una buena inversión, hasta el momento cuenta con un buen nivel de mercadería y espera seguir en crecimiento con el negocio.
texts.en: Delfina has decided on a new loan to improve her business; she feels it is necessary to purchase merchandise for the snack bar, like snacks, sodas, juices, cookies, sweets, and other foods that her customers are asking for. She claims to have had a positive outcome with the previous loan, because she managed to make a good investment. Up to now, she has had a good level of supplies and hopes to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, sodas, juices, cookies, and sweets.

loans.name: Gloria Hermelinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHASKA ÑAHUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria Hermelinda;La socia continua dedicandose a las manualidades ella elabora lo que son servilletas,manteles entre otros, la socia trabaja para uno de los hoteles de la ciudad de Cusco,ya son varios años que trabaja en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar adelante.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio como telas. 


La socia está agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria Hermelinda belongs to the “CHASKA ÑAHUI” Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

She continues dedicating herself to the handicrafts she makes such as napkins and tablecloths, among other items. She works for one of the hotels in Cusco. She has been making her handicrafts for several years and her business has gone very well, thanks to the effort she puts into it each day.  She is a happy and responsible person who wants to continue moving forward.

Gloria Hermelinda is requesting the loan to purchase materials for her business, such as fabrics. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business such as fabrics.

loans.name: Tabby

texts.en: Tabby is a married woman who describes herself as focused. She operates a flower garden where she sells flowers. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs 3 staff members. Tabby's business is located in a fast growing business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost charged by city council. Tabby will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy flowers and pots. Her business goal is to own a piece of land within 5 years. Tabby hopes that, in the future, she will run another flower garden and create job opportunities for people.

loans.use: to buy more flowers and pots.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida operates a grocery store adjacent to her home. She sells different grocery items such as salt, sugar, cooking oils, etc. to her customers at reasonable rates.

Her husband is a fruit seller and sells fresh, seasonal fruits.

Zubaida is the mother of five children. One of them works, while the other stays at home.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to further expand her grocery store.

With the loan investment, she will buy a different variety of groceries for her shop. This will allow her to fulfill her client's orders and increase her profits.

She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that her business will succeed as a result of this investment.

loans.use: To buy items for her grocery store business

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a widow who lives with her two children. Because of her need to generate an income to improve her family’s well-being, Chari began her business selling fruits and vegetables. Her main clients are the neighboring community members.

Chari is requesting a first loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust, an organization she joined five months ago which made it possible for her to set up her business. Chari will use the loan to buy crates of fresh vegetables and fruits for resale in order to increase her opportunities in the market, such as responding to new customers referred by current buyers and those whose attention she wants to capture. She will buy supplies in quantity, which will allow her to buy at a discount for cash and large volume.

loans.use: to buy crates of fresh vegetables and fruits for resale

loans.name: Sobhi

texts.en:
Sobhi is a 36-year-old engaged man who has been working as a carpenter for ten years. Sobhi specializes in making wooden doors, closets, and furniture. He is very talented in his business and highly recommended by his customers.

Sobhi applied for his first loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools for his business. He might also use part of the loan to finish building his dream house to get married soon. His house isn't too big since he is Palestinian, and the only place he can build it is in the Palestinian camp where he already lives. Sobhi is a hard worker who dreams of a bright future for himself and his family. He doesn't rest because he wants to expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for his business

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa, 26 years old, is single and blessed with one child, 3 years old. For the past year, she has operated a dairy business, buying and selling fresh milk. The business brings in a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

This is Sharifa's first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase fresh milk for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to repay her loan and to pay her workers. Sharifa's hopes and dreams are to expand her fresh milk selling business and to provide her family with a better, more comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase fresh milk for resale.

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rosario es una joven de 23 años de edad, ella vive en la linda ciudad de Pisco, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo podemos encontrar playas hermosas, se realizan las actividades de agricultura así como también pesca artesanal, también encontramos las Islas Ballestas y el Candelabro de Paracas los cuales reciben infinidad de turistas en todo el año. Rosario es madre soltera, tiene una pequeña de 1 año de edad y es su adoración, cuando se siente un poco preocupara o triste mira a su pequeña y con ello logra sacar fuerzas para salir adelante, su niña es lo mejor y lo más importante que tiene en la vida y por ello trabaja muy duro para salir adelante, Rosario se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir, es costurera desde hace ya 4 años y con el fruto de su trabajo puede mantener a su niña y solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella inicio su negocio con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro ya que anteriormente trabajo como ayudante en una empresa de tejidos. Rosario es muy creativa y sobre todo responsable y cumplida con los clientes, es por ello que ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo y por ello día con día ella da todo de si para seguir creciendo.

Rosario está muy feliz con la ayuda que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una maquina remalladora semi industrial con la que podrá dar un mejor terminado a sus prendas y poder confeccionar prendas con materiales más gruesos , así ella podrá seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorando sus ingresos, de esa manera ella podrá seguir día a día trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Darle una profesión a su hija y una vida feliz”.
texts.en:
Rosario is a young woman of 23. She lives in the lovely city of Pisco, which is noted for its very warm and inviting climate. As well, we can find beautiful beaches. Agriculural activities, as well as small-scale fishing are also carried on. There we also find the Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Candelabra, which receive huge numbers of tourists throughout the year. 

Rosario is a single mother and has a small one-year-old whom she adores. When she feels a bit worried or sad she looks at her little one and this way manages to find the strength to keep going. Her little girl is the best and most important thing she has in her life, so she works very hard to succeed. 

Rosario sews articles of clothing, and has been a seamstress for four years now. With the proceeds of her work she is able to support her little girl and pay for the household expenses. She started her business with a great deal of effort and by saving, as she previously worked as a helper in a knitting company. 

Rosario is very creative, and above all responsible and polite to her customers. She thinks this is the reason her business is doing well, so day by day she devotes herself completely to keeping her business growing. 

Rosario is very happy about the help she has been offered by the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have provided her, she will be able to buy a semi-industrial serger, with which she will be able to do better finishing work on her clothing articles, and be able to sew garments with thicker materials. 

This way she will be able to continue growing in her business and improving her income. In that way she will be able to continue working day by day to make her biggest dream a reality: "To enable her daughter to have a profession and a happy life."

loans.use: To buy an industrial serger.

loans.name: Ghaleb

texts.en:
Ghaleb is a 43-year-old married man and a father of seven children. He works in the agricultural business and it is his one and only source for living. 

Ghaleb raises livestock, and he trades with their milk and meat. His business is just fine but needs an external small push to keep it improving.

He applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary food for his livestock with special prices. He is already an Al Majmoua borrower for five cycles. All of his previous loans helped a lot in improving his business and his family's social and financial situations.

Ghaleb will also invest part of the loan in paying for his child's school fees. He is strict when it comes to education because he dreams to see all of his children highly educated unlike him.

He might also, if it is possible, make necessary maintenance to his house before the autumn/winter season.

loans.use: to buy necessary food for his livestock

loans.name: Jose Lucas

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultura y a la reparación de bicicletas, vive con su esposa y una hija, él aprendió la agricultura por su padre, ya tiene ocho años realizándolo para su beneficio familiar, la reparación de las bicicletas lo aprendió por iniciativa propia.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, pues se dispone a preparar el terreno para realizar el cultivo, para esto deberá comprarse abono, herbicidas, semilla de maíz, que son los necesarios para prevenir las plagas y fortalecer su crecimiento.
La aspiración de José, es que a través del préstamo pueda realizar una buena milpa, la cual le produzca lo necesario y tambien quiere mejorar su trabajo en el taller de bicicletas, para ofrecer una mejor estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
José farms and also repairs bicycles. He lives with his wife and a daughter. He learned farming from his father, and already has eight years doing it for his family's benefit. He learned to repair bicycles on his own initiative. 

He is requesting a loan in order to buy agricultural supplies, as he is getting ready to prepare the land for cultivation. For this he will have to buy fertilizer, herbicides and corn seeds. These are necessary to prevent pests and to strengthen the growth of the crop.

José's ambition is that through the loan he can plant a good corn crop, which produces what he needs. He also wants to improve the work he does in his bicycle workshop, so that he can provide better stability to his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, herbicides and corn seeds.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es:
José, es comerciante de mariscos, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 15,8 y 2 años de edad, él realiza sus compras de mariscos por mayor y los distribuye en otros departamentos, lo realiza cada dos días, tiene experiencia en el negocio y conoce de la calidad del producto. 
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de mariscos, pues necesita de dinero para tener mayor disponibilidad y comprarse por mayor los pescados, conchas, camarones de diferentes medidas, entre otras especies. Este préstamo será una fortaleza para él y su negocio, ya que tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar y crecer en productos. 
La aspiración de José es crecer en el negocio, a futuro tiene los planes de comprarse otro vehículo en el cual pueda transportar producto para otros puntos del país.
texts.en:
José is a seafood seller. He lives with his wife and three children who are fifteen, eight, and two years old. He makes his wholesale seafood purchases and distributes them in other departments every other day. He has experience in the business and knows the quality of the product.

He is requesting a loan to purchase seafood, as he needs the money to have greater availability and to buy wholesale fish, clams, and shrimp of different sizes, among other species. This loan will strengthen his business, since he will have the opportunity to increase his inventory.

José's aspiration is to grow his business; in the future he has plans to purchase another vehicle with which he could transport his products to other parts of the country.

loans.use: to purchase fish, clams, and shrimp.

loans.name: Ganzaya

texts.en: Ganzaya, 29, lives with her parents and two daughters in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She is a single mom. Her daughters go to kindergarten. Her mother and grandmother are running a children's shoe (Buryat) production business. Her mother and grandmother taught her how to make Buryat shoes. She learned to make shoes when she was 14 years old. Now she would like to start her own shoe-making business. The raw material for Buryat shoes is much cheaper in the summer. Therefore, she wants to buy cheaper raw materials in a large quantity. She is diligent and humble woman. She says, "I am responsible for my daughters. They will soon start school. I would like to increase my income for their future." She is requesting 810,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to raw materials for shoes.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for shoes.

loans.name: Emis Arelis

texts.es: Emis es una mujer de 37 años de edad que vive en el barrio Los Angeles 3 de Barranquilla, donde comercializa sandalias femeninas y queso por libras. Hace dos años, cuando se separó del padre de sus hijos, se vio en la necesidad de buscar una fuente de ingreso que asegurara el bienestar suyo y de su familia.  Fue así cuando encontró la oportunidad de vender queso proveniente del municipio de Pivijay, en el departamento del Magdalena, su pueblo natal. Cada vez que viajaba a hacer las compras, observaba que existía un mercado potencial al que le podía vender algún producto diferente que le generara otros ingresos además de ayudarle a solventar los gastos ocasionados. Ideó entonces vender por encargo y a crédito las sandalias que fabrica su hermano de manera artesanal. Con su primer credikiva, Emis pretende aumentar sus ventas no sólo comprando un mayor número de sandalias para la venta sino que quiere comprar un motor de máquina de coser para reparar una de su propiedad y suministrarla a su hermano para incrementar la producción y ampliar la capacidad instalada. Es un negocio familiar en el que varios integrantes aportan un poco para la actividad y trabajan arduamente para que este crezca tanto en espacio como en infraestructura, dotado de buenas máquinas y que sea reconocido ampliamente.  Vive con sus hijos menores de edad, de 16 y 13 años a los que anhela brindarles un futuro mejor especialmente con las condiciones habitacionales adecuadas, ya que el lugar donde reside actualmente no es el mejor.
texts.en:
Emis is a 37 year-old-woman who lives in Barrio Los Angeles 3 in Barranquilla, where she sells women’s sandals and cheese by the pound. Two years ago when she separated from the father of her children she saw the necessity of looking for a source of income that would insure the wellbeing of herself and her family. Then she found an opportunity to sell cheese from the town of Pivijay in the department of Magdalena, her birthplace. Each time she traveled to make purchases, she observed that there was a potential market for selling a different product that would generate additional income beyond the costs incurred. She then got the idea to sell on credit hand crafted custom sandals made by her brother.

With her first Kiva loan, Emis aims to increase her sales not only by buying a larger number of sandals to sell but  she wants to buy a sewing machine motor to repair one she owns and give it to her brother so that he can increase production and expand capacity.  This is a family business in that various members each contribute a little to the business and work arduously so that it grows in space as well as in infrastructure, equipped with good machines, and becomes widely recognized.

Emis lives with her minor children, aged 16 and 13, for whom she longs to provide a better future, especially with respect to their living conditions because the place where she currently lives is not the best.

loans.use: to purchase women's sandals to sell as well as a motor to repair a sewing machine.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a fifty-seven-year-old married man with seven children. He has run a boutique business for two years now, earning a monthly income of fifty thousand shillings.  This will be his second loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the loan to purchase more stock of clothes for sale. He intends to use the profit for opening another boutique. He hopes to have a good future.

loans.use: purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Darcy

texts.es:
Darcy tiene 24 años, es una mujer decidida y emprendedora, que le gusta el trabajo y sabe que con esfuerzo se logra progresar. Está casada con Jhon, quien es policía en actividad. Ellos se esfuerzan por tener una  mejor calidad de vida y juntos viven en la casa que compraron antes de casarse.

Su actividad es la venta de medicamentos en pequeñas cantidades desde su vivienda, atendiendo principalmente a sus vecinos. Así también, en su tiempo libre realiza el servicio de manicure y pedicura; y además cuenta, hace 3 años, con un empleo rotativo de atención en una farmacia privada donde aprendió sobre medicamentos. Con su propio negocio lleva 3 años, incursionó con ello debido a la necesidad de los vecinos de su barrio por medicamentos. Viendo lo buenos resultados está ahorrando sus ganancias para invertir en un futuro en la venta de comida los domingos en su casa.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos, de esa manera obtener la confianza de tener acceso a otros créditos en el futuro. 
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de los medicamentos básicos para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Darcy is 24, she is decisive and entrepreneurial woman, she likes to work and knows that with effort it's possible to make progress.  she is married to Jhon who is a police officer.  They make the effort to achieve a better quality of life and they live together in a house they bought before getting married.

Her business activity is the sale of medicine in small quantities from her home, she mainly sells to the neighbors.  In addition during her free time she provides manicure and pedicure services and also has a casual job at a private pharmacy where she has worked for three years and where she learned about medicine.  She has had her own business for three years and started working there because she saw her neighbors in need of medicine.  After seeing the good results of the business she is saving up her profit to invest in the future to start selling food from her house on Sundays.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support, because this way she feels confident to continue with her business.  She also commits to be punctual with her loan repayments and this way earn the trust to have more loans in the future.  With the loan requested of 1,000 new soles she will invest in buying basic medicine to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy basic medicine so she can have more in-stock.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing and embroidery business. With the loan investment she will buy beads and threads to provide better embroidery services to her clients. She will also buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete client orders on time and increase her income.

Naseem's husband is a property dealer and deals in houses, land, etc.  She has given birth to 3 children, 2 of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.  She is very active lady and performs her household duties very well along with her business.  She is confident about her business success as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 48-year-old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be an ambitious man. 

Benson operates a retail store where he sells items such as iron sheets, water tanks, buckets, gutters, etc. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a fast growing area and his primary customers are clients from the nearby town. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy iron sheets for selling. His business goal is to run many more retail shops within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business and use the profits generated to buy a piece of land for his family.

loans.use: buy iron sheets to resell

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a thirty-one-year-old married man with one child. He runs a video shooting / show business. He has been in this business for three years.

This will be Walter's second loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to use the loan to purchase a new decoder machine for DSTV, and he plans to use the profit to purchase his own plot of land.  He hopes to be a prosperous business man in the future.

loans.use: buy a video decoder machine

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is married and has one child.  He runs a barber shop  business and has been in this business for three years, earning a monthly income of twenty five thousand shillings.

This will be Evans' first loan from KADET LTD and  he plans to use it for purchasing more shaving materials. He plans to use the profit to purchase a posho mill.   He hopes to be a good businessman in the future.

loans.use: buy shaving supplies such as razor blades, spirit, and towels

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is s 40-year-old business lady. She is married to John, who is a business man. They are blessed with two children, aged 14 and 10 years. She has been a tailor for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Anastasia is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  She will use the loan to purchase stocks of clothing materials and sewing threads. 

With the anticipated profit from the business Anastasia will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop, expand the tailoring business and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: buy sewing materials

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth  is a 29-year-old married man. He describes himself to be a focused man. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as snacks, sodas, bread, flour, rice, sweets, etc. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located within a market and his primary customers are residents within the nearby estates. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding the business. 

Japheth will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy home products. His business goal is to run a supermarket within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to purchase land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy home products.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is twenty-three-years old, married and has one child.  She sells assorted fruits and has been in this business for five years, earning a monthly income of eight thousand shillings.  This will be her first loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use it for purchasing more fruits such as mangoes, bananas and pineapples.  

Gladys plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to build her own house. She hopes to be a prosperous business lady.

loans.use: buy fruits to resell

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 24-year-old woman from Kisumu City, western Kenya. She is married to Patrick, and they have two children aged six and three years.

Pamela operates a second-hand clothing sales business, a business she has been operating for the last two years, and makes a monthly income of 9,000 KES.

Pamela is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a bale of second-hand clothing to sell. Her profits will be used to educate her children. Pamela's dream is to be a successful businesswoman in Kisumu.

loans.use: to buy a bale of second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This is Francisca, 53, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Manolo, her business partner, and is a mother of three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Francisca operates a variety store. In the Philippines.  A variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  Francisca  earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Francisca is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Francisca hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Oluwatobi 4 Group

texts.fr: OLUWATOBI 4 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine et s'approvisionnent au même endroit. La représentante du groupe, Ganiatou (qui a la main levée sur la photo), est âgée de 54 ans et est mariée. Le couple a trois enfants, tous leur charge. Ganiatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari, et assure ensemble avec lui les diverses charges du ménage. Pour faire face à ses divers besoins, Ganiatou mène comme activité la vente de parfums par le système de distribution. Ganiatou s'approvisionne à Lomé. C'est la troisième fois que Ganiatou et les autres membres du groupe OLUWATOBI 4 sollicitent un financement de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer leurs activités et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group "OLUWATOBI 4" consists of three members who belong to the same savings group and get their supplies from the same source.  The group's representative, Ganiatou, is 54 years old and married (she is also the person raising her hand in the photo).

Ganiatou and her husband have three children, all their dependents.  Ganiatou lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband.

In order to meet her various needs, Ganiatou has been selling perfumes through the distribution system.  She buys her goods in Lomé.

It is the third time that Ganiatou and the other members of the OLUWATOBI 4 group are requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to strengthen their activities and to better meet their clients' needs.

loans.use: to buy boxes of perfumes.

loans.name: Ouynchimeg

texts.en:
Ouynchimeg, 34, lives with her husband and 2 sons in Bayanulgii province, Mongolia. Her older son is a secondary school student and younger son is a Kindergarten student. Ouynchimeg started a grocery store business in 2010. Her husband helps with her business. The grocery products she sells are not enough for her customers, and she wants to purchase more products to sell in her grocery store. 

Also, Ouynchimeg's house windows have gotten old. In the wintertime, it costs a lot of money to warm her house due to the heat loss through the windows. Ouynchimeg wants to repair her house windows. She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT: 2,000,000 MNT to purchase vacuum windows to repair her house windows and the rest to purchase new products to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum windows to repair her house windows.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 46. She is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a single mother of three children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Susan operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Susan dreams to be able to expand her business. She hopes to be financially free one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Tuvemubujiji /rbv Group

texts.fr:
Speciose  fait partie du groupe Tuvemubujiji. Le nom du groupe signifie «arrachons nous dans l’ignorance ». Elle a 45 ans, elle est marie avec 6 enfants de 8 ans à 18 ans, dont 5 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Speciose est agriculteur des pommes de terre. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 35 kgs des maïs des semences, 200 kgs des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture, elle planifie d’augmenter l’étendu de son agriculture en achetant des autres champs. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait être une agricultrice professionnelle. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de continuer à payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et bâtir une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Speciose is a member of the Tuvemubujiji group.  The name of the group means "Let's fight ignorance".

Speciose is 45 years old.  She is married and has 6 children, ages 8 to 18, five of whom are in school.  She completed six years of primary school.

Speciose is a potato farmer.  This is her third loan cycle with ACB.  She will use her loan to buy 35 kg of maize seeds, 200 kg of fertilizers, and to pay for the cost of labor.

In order to boost her farming business, she is planning to buy other fields and increase the surface area of her cultivated land.  In the coming years, she would like to become a professional farmer.  

With the profits, she is planning to continue to pay her children's school fees and would also like to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy 35 kg of maize seeds, 200 kg of fertilizers, and to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina tiene 33 años, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casada con Jorge, quien es pintor de artes plásticas y padre de su hija Angi de 5 años. Viven juntos en la comodidad de la casa que compraron con el fruto de sus ahorros de varios años. 

Carolina se dedica a la venta de los cuadros que elabora su esposo. Cuentan con un espacio acondicionado en su vivienda donde exhibe y atiende a sus clientes, quienes la buscan por los bonitos motivos de las pinturas, especialmente detalles de zona selva donde viven. En este negocio los ayuda un amigo que se encuentra en el extranjero y que también ofrece y vende los cuadros allá. Se inicio hace más de 15 años, ahora son reconocidos en su localidad y admiran el arte de su esposo; aunque él también se dedica a brindar transporte público en motocarro. 

Este es el préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además está satisfecha con su banco comunal, pues le gusta el apoyo que brindan a las personas con deseos de superación.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1800 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de los materiales que necesita su esposo para los cuadros; como pinturas acrílicas, oleos, lona, marcos y otros.
texts.en:
Carolina is 33 years old. She is a hardworking and determined woman who is very motivated to get ahead. She is married to Jorge, who is a fine arts painter and the father of their five-year-old daughter Angi. They live together in the comfort of the house they bought with the fruit of several years' savings.

Carolina works selling the canvases that her husband produces. They have a specially equipped space in their residence where they exhibit the work and attend to their customers, who come to them because of the paintings' beautiful motifs, especially details of the rainforest region where they live. A friend who lives abroad helps them in this business by offering and selling the paintings there. The business started more than 15 years ago and they are now recognized in their area and her husband's art is admired; however, he also works providing transportation to the public with a three-wheeled van.

This is loan number 8 with the institution MFP; Carolina is very happy to know that she has financial support, because this way she feels sure she will advance her business. In addition, she is pleased with her communal bank, as she likes the support they provide to people who want to improve themselves. 

With the amount requested—1800 nuevos soles (PEN)—Carolina will invest in the purchase of supplies that her husband needs for his paintings, like acrylic paints, oil paints, canvas, frames, etc.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the paintings that her husband does.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 32-year-old lady from Kisumu and is married to Boaz.  They have three children between the ages of three and 13.

Lilian operates a grocery store, a business she has been doing for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES 7,000. She is currently taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of eggs and vegetables for sale. 

Her profits will be used to cater to her household needs and expenses.  Her dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs and vegetables.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 28 years old and married. He makes detergents and soap to sell. He has been in this business for seven years. He enjoys his work and describes it as being good, with reliable customers. 

Joseph previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped him grow his business. He has also managed to improve his business through Faulu Kenya, because he has been trained in business management. Joseph needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy a motorcycle for the easy transportation of his products.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport the detergents and soap he manufactures.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is thirty years old, married to Faith, and blessed with three children ages nine, five, and three years. He is a tailor, a business he started twelve years ago, and earns a monthly income of 35,000 KES. Samson wants to purchase more cloth materials and has requested a first loan of 10,000 KES. 

The profit Samson makes from his business will help him repay his loan and support his family's needs. He dreams of becoming a prominent businessman.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for his business.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 30 years old and has one child. She runs a beauty salon and has two employees. She has been in the business for two years. She describes her business as competitive and has reliable customers.

She hopes that in five years her business will expand and the number of customers will increase. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 52-year-old widowed woman. She has 4 children between the ages of 17 and 38 years. She works very hard to support her family as she is their sole provider. She describes herself as a determined woman. 

Jane owns poultry and operates a retail stall where she sells timber and eggs. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a market, and her primary customers are residents of the nearby estates. She describes her biggest business challenge as the outbreak of diseases that affect the chickens, especially during cold seasons. 

Jane will use the loan of 15,000 KES to buy spinning materials to start a new business making carpets to sell. Her business goal is to become a supplier of eggs and chickens for supermarkets within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land with the profits generated and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy spinning materials to start a business making carpets to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick needs another loan to repair his motorcycle. He is a 27-year-old hardworking married man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a dream of building his own house in the next three years. He has been into motorcycle riding for four years and the business is very profitable.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola tiene 21 años, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de alegre y muy atenta. Su pareja es Gino, quien es policía. Juntos habitan en la casa de su madre, con sus padres, su hermana y su cuñado. Aun no tienen hijos.

Ella se dedica a la venta de lubricantes, para lo cual se instaló en un local alquilado, en sociedad con una amiga, donde atiende mayormente su socia, pues Paola también es policía y tiene turnos rotativos. Inició su negocio hace más de un mes, por la idea de su amiga, compartiendo ganancias equitativas. Lo considera bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, pues se logra vender muchos lubricantes, por la demanda y el crecimiento del parque a automotor.
Por ello desea contratar más personal para la atención al público, pues ve que se llena el local y no le gusta que no se pueda atender adecuadamente a todos.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP y se ha integrado a un banco comunal donde se siente cómoda, pues todos son personas amables y solidarias, por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de lubricantes, en mayor volumen, para aumentar su stock disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
Paola is a 21 year old woma. She is hard-working, determined, cheerful and very smart. Her partner is Gino, who is a policeman. Together they live in her mother's house, with her ​​parents, sister and brother. They have no children.

She sells lubricants, from a rented shop, in partnership with a girl friend who does most of the time in the shop, as Paola is also a police-woman and has rotating shifts. They started this business more than a month ago. It was her friend's idea and they share profits equally. She considers it quite profitable, as they can sell many lubricants, thanks to high demand and the growth of the automotive park. For this reason they want to hire more staff to serve customers. Paola sees the shop full of customers and does not like that she cannot serve them all properly. 

This is her first loan with MFP and she has become a member of a community bank where she feels comfortable, the other members are all friendly and supportive people. She agrees to comply with the repayments. With the requested amount (1000 Soles) she will invest in the purchase of lubricants, in greater volume, to increase their stock available for sale.

loans.use: To buy lubricants for her motor oil shop

loans.name: Naghada's Group

texts.en:
Naghada is a 43-year-old Iraqi woman. She is a widow; since the death of her husband, she has been raising 3 children alone. With limited career options because of cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Naghada is one of the many Iraqi woman who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some additional income to meet the financial needs of herself and her children. 

She has 6 years' experience with her sewing and tailoring. Trying to improve her work and opportunities, she would like to buy a small generator, an over machine, an iron stand, and some fabric. The generator will allow her to work even during the hours the power is off - which happens frequently in her city - while the other items will help her offer a better variety of services for her customers.

In order to make these purchases, Naghada took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a small generator, an over machine, an iron stand and some fabric.

loans.name: Sardaran's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran is married and a mother of six children. She could not provide them with an education due to financial constraints. She is a housewife and remains at home, taking care of her household responsibilities.

Sardaran has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner Asasah to make further improvements to her husband's business selling vegetables in the vegetable market. With the loan investment, Sardaran's husband will buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell to his clients for profit. He has been operating this business for many years, and Sardaran is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal vegetables for a vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Margaretha

texts.en:
Margaretha, 26, is operating a kiosk business. She used to work as a part-time employee at a health center. After the contract ended, Margaretha found it hard to get a new job. This situation then led her to open a small kiosk at her home. 

At the kiosk, Margaretha sells several household necessities such as instant noodles, soap bars, detergent, sugar, tea, and coffee. Margaretha is still living with her parents, but she doesn’t want to rely on them.

Margaretha plans to build a small kiosk located separately from the house and to add more products to sell at her kiosk. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She would like to buy more products for her kiosk, and building materials such as zinc, cement, nails, wood and bricks.

loans.use: to buy more products for her kiosk, and building materials such as zinc, cement, nails, wood and bricks.

loans.name: Jully

texts.en:
Jully is a 46-year-old female entrepreneur from Kisumu City, situated in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Julius, and they have 4 children ages 18 (twins), 20 and 21.

Jully operates a tailoring business in Kisumu, a business she has had for the last 10 years, and earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES. She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy textiles for tailoring work. Jully plans to use her profits to increase her textile materials capacity.

Jully's dream is to become a leading supplier of textile materials.

loans.use: to buy textiles for tailoring work.

loans.name: Maliha

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 56 years old, married and has three children, all of whom work.

Maliha has owned a cattle farm since 1999; she gained sufficient experience in this field from her family. She has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas.
 
She applied for a $1,500 loan in order to purchase a Friesian cow and to buy more cattle feed. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so that she can provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a Friesian cow and to buy more cattle feed.

loans.name: Nishteeman's Group

texts.en:
Nishteeman is a 30-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and has one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Nishteeman is one of the many Iraqi women who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Working from home, Nishteeman has five years of experience using her sewing skills to make dresses and fabric household items based on custom orders. With a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq, she would like to purchase a small generator to allow her to work on the frequent occasions when the power is out. She would also like to buy an overlock sewing machine and an iron to better serve her customers.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated based on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase a small generator, an overlock sewing machine and an iron.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 39 años, es una mujer emprendedora, solidaria y muy trabajadora. Lleva mucho tiempo separada de quien fue su pareja por muchos años y con quien tuvo tres hijos de 23, 18 y 16 años. Comparte su día a día junto a ellos, en su casa propia, entrega todo su esfuerzo para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de pescado fresco o salado. Esta labor la realiza personalmente, de manera diaria o semanal, en los principales mercados de la ciudad. La cantidad de pescado y la frecuencia con que los pone a la venta depende estrictamente de los resultados de la jornada de pesca que realiza en los ríos de la ciudad. Realiza este trabajo con la ayuda y colaboración de sus hermanos, ellos se encargan de pescar las especies que tienen mayor demanda y mejor tamaño, respetando siempre las épocas de veda. Lleva en este negocio muchos años y los ingresos económicos que le produce son muy beneficiosos, ya que en muchas oportunidades ha logrado triplicar su inversión inicial. Al momento de ir a realizar sus faenas de pesca lleva consigo ropa, la cual vende en los centros poblados que están ubicados cerca de las riberas de los ríos; de esa manera genera un ingreso adicional.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque adora estar en contacto con la naturaleza, disfrutar de la belleza de los ríos, dedicar su tiempo a lo que mejor sabe hacer y contribuye a la conservación de las especies, es por ello que no le agrada ver que otros pescadores, con ambición de riqueza, realizan su trabajo contaminando los ríos o capturan especies no permitidas y de tamaños pequeños que no han realizado su etapa de reproducción. Su meta es conseguir un puesto fijo en algún mercado de su localidad.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
El monto solicitado (S/. 1000) lo invertirá en su negocio de pesca con la compra de redes nuevas, algunas trampas y hielo que utiliza para la conservación.
texts.en:
Julia, 39, is an enterprising, supportive, hard-working woman.  She has been divorced many years from her husband, with whom she had three children, ages 23, 18 and 16.  She lives with them in her own house and makes every effort to give them the best quality of life possible.

Her business is selling fresh and salted fish.  She works daily or weekly at the main markets in the city.  The quantity of fish and frequency of sale depends strictly on the daily fishing activity in the city rivers.  Her brothers help out by collaborating and fishing the species that are in highest demand and the best size, always respecting the fishing season.  She has been in business for many years and the income is very advantageous, since sometimes she triples the initial investment.  When she goes out to sell fish sometimes she takes clothing to sell in the villages on the riverbanks, which is an additional source of income.

She likes what she does because she is in contact with nature, enjoying the beauty of the rivers, spending time doing what she does best and contributing to species preservation.  That is why she does not like seeing other fisherman who only want to get rich, contaminating the rivers and capturing small sized, illegal species.  Her goal is to have a permanent stall at the village market.

This is her first loan through MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity and trust placed in her.  She is also committed to paying the loan back on time.  She enjoys belonging to her communal bank because she sees all the members as being responsible and supportive.

The loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN will be used to buy new nets, traps and ice for preservation.

loans.use: To buy new nets, traps and ice.

loans.name: Aryan's Group

texts.en:
Aryan is 32 years old. She is a married Iraqi woman with two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Aryan is one of the many Iraqi women who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Aryan has six years of experience in the small business activity. Working from her home, she makes custom order dresses and small household items.

In the past, she received and successfully repaid a loan to Relief International - Microfinance Iraq which she used to replace her old sewing machine and purchase fabric. Aryan would like to further improve her work opportunities and offer more to her customers. She would like to buy an overlock sewing machine and additional quality fabrics and raw materials. To make these purchases, she requested a new loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated based on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and additional quality fabrics and raw materials.

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas, una de ellas trabaja y la otra le ayuda en su venta, ella  administra la venta de tortillas  tiene aproximadamente 10 años de estar en el negocio.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales como el maíz y leña, que son los necesarios para realizar la venta, este préstamo le permitirá comprarse al contado una buena cantidad de maíz la cual lograra obtener a bajo precio.
El objetivo de ella es pagar puntual este préstamo, poder crear una buena relación con la institución, ya que le permitirá crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana makes tortillas for a living.  She lives in her own house with her husband and two daughters, one of which works and the other helps in the business by managing sales.  

For approximately ten years she has been in business and is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as corn and firewood, which are necessary for her sales.  The loan will allow her to pay cash for a good amount of corn, lowering the cost.

Her goal is to pay back the loan on time and create a good relationship with the instititution, which will help her grow in her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as corn and firewood.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura tiene 48 años, es una mujer amable, servicial y muy trabajadora. Está casada y fruto de su matrimonio tiene tres hijos de 21, 18 y el menor de 13 años. Ellos viven juntos, como una familia muy unida, en su casa propia, la que pudieron comprar a base a esfuerzo y sacrificio.

Su trabajo es la venta de productos de belleza, desde perfumes, cosméticos hasta productos de arreglo personal. Trabaja sola y la venta la realiza mediante el trato directo a sus clientes, quien en su mayoría son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, además de sus compañeros de trabajo, ya que labora en una entidad del estado.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace, pues le permite generar ingresos económicos adicionales para su familia y con eso puede pagar, de manera puntual, sus cuentas. Cuando se inició en su trabajo encontró algunas dificultades, como la falta de poder de convencimiento sobre la calidad de sus productos, lo que le impedía vender con rapidez, pero al final pudo vencer esa barrera y ahora es una excelente vendedora. Tiene muchos planes a futuro, entre ellos está el de mejorar su actividad, implementando una pequeña tienda en su vivienda.

Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en anteriormente. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) comprará productos de belleza para tener en stock y así tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Laura, 48, is a kind, service-oriented, hard-working woman.  She is married and has three children, ages 21, 18 and 13.  They are a close-knit family who all live together in their own house which they bought through hard work and sacrifice.

Her job consists of selling beauty products such as perfumes, cosmetics and personal care items.  She works alone and sells directly to her customers, most of whom are neighbors, friends and relatives.  She also sells to her work colleagues, since she works for a state company.

She enjoys what she does because it generates an additional income for the family, making it easier to pay bills on time.  When she started the business there were some difficulties, such as not having the power of conviction regarding the quality of the products, taking longer to make a sale.  But finally this barrier was overcome and she is now an excellent salesperson.  She has many plans for the future, among which is improving her business by setting up a small shop in her home.

This is her fourth loan through MFP and she is grateful to those who are allowing her to continue toward her goals.  Also, she is very committed, once again, to paying back the loan on time, as she did previously.  She is happy about belonging to her communal bank because all the members are good, kind and supportive.

The loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN will be used to buy beauty products to increase her inventory and obtain more income.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Twifatanye /rbv Group

texts.fr:
Christine  fait partie du groupe Twifatanye. Le nom du groupe signifie «United group ». Elle a 31 ans, elle est marie avec 5 enfants de 3 ans à 13 ans, dont 5 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Christine est agriculteur des pommes de terre. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 30 kgs des maïs des semences, 150 kgs des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture, elle planifie d’augmenter le quantité des semences et augmenter l’étendu de son agriculture en achetant des autres champs. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait être une agricultrice professionnelle dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer les frais scolaire supérieur pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Christine is part of the Twifatanye group, the name of which means “the united group”. She is 31 years of age, and is married with five children aged between three and 13. All of her five children are at school, and she herself studied six years of elementary school.

Christine grows potatoes. This is her third loan cycle with ACB, and she plans to use her loan to buy 30 kilos of corn seed and 150 kilos of fertilizers, and to pay her labor expenses. To increase her production, she plans to plant more seeds and extend the scope of her planting by buying more fields. Over the coming years Christine would like to become a professional grower in her region. With the profits she earns, she would like to pay for her children’s higher education expenses.

loans.use: To buy 30 kilos of corn seed and 150 kilos of fertilizers, and to pay her labor expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy 30 kilos of corn seed and 200 kilos of fertilizers, and to pay her labor expenses

loans.name: Dilkosh's Group

texts.en:
Dilkosh is a married Iraqi woman. She is 27 years old and a mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Dilkosh is one of the many Iraqi women who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has been busy with her little sewing/tailoring business for the past two years, and working from home, she is constantly looking for ways to improve her opportunities. 

In the past, Dilkosh received and successfully repaid a loan to Relief International - Microfinance Iraq. At the time, she purchased a sewing machine and some raw materials. To make further improvements to the variety of jobs she can offer her customers, Dilkosh would like to buy an overlock sewing machine and an embroidery machine. In order to make these purchases, Dilkosh requested a new loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated based on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Madame Astou qui loge à environ 22 km de la ville principale, est une vendeuse de légumes et de denrées alimentaires  depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est une habituée du guichet car elle est à son 6ème crédit. Astou est mariée et mère de famille. Elle a installé une table devant chez elle ce qui arrange d’une part ses voisines qui n’ont pas l’occasion d’aller au marché pour se ravitailler en condiments. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200000 FCFA afin de pouvoir acheter des légumes, du poisson séché et fumé et exposer  sur sa table.
Astou donne un coup de main à son mari car elle l’appui dans la dépense quotidienne du foyer. Elle réussi à épargner grâce aux revenus générés  par son activité et à améliorer les conditions alimentaires de ses enfants. Elle a besoin de plus de fond pour élargir son activité.
texts.en:
Astou lives approximately 22 kilometers from the main village, and has sold vegetables and staple foods for more than ten years. She is a regular client of this branch as this is her sixth loan. 

Astou is married and is a mother. She has set up a table in front of her house for some of her neighbors who cannot go to the market to stock up on seasonings. She has requested a loan of 200,000 francs CFA to buy vegetables and dried and smoked fish to sell on her table.

Astou gives her husband a hand with her support towards the daily household expenses. She manages to save thanks to the revenues generated by her business, and has made improvements with respect to the food her children eat. She needs more cash to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy staple foods: vegetables and smoked and dried fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy 40 kilos of corn seed and 45 kilos of fertilizers, and to pay her labor expenses.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou est une sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’IMCEC qui se trouve à environ  22 km de la ville principale. Elle fait de la vente de produits alimentaires. Elle veut acheter des fruits et en même temps elle fait du commerce de poisson séché et même de l’oignon. Fatou a acquis une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans ce domaine.
Elle ne reste pas les bras croisés car elle participe à la dépense journalière de la  famille. Elle veut augmenter son fond de roulement  et pour cela elle veut faire recourt à l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Fatou is a member of one of the local branches of Kiva's partner, IMCEC, located 22 kilometers from the main city. She sells food products and wants to purchase fruits. At the same time, she also sells dried fish, and even onions.

Fatou acquired more than 20 years of experience in this field. She doesn't lay idle since she takes part in covering the family's daily expenses. She wants to bolster her working capital, which is why she's seeking a loan from IMCEC.

loans.use: to buy fruits and other food products, such as dried fish and onions

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en la compra de materiales agrícolas, este préstamo le servirá como complemento para dicha compra en abono, herbicidas, que son los que se aplican al cultivo de maíz y frijol, para poderlo prevenir de las plagas.
Con el préstamo anterior comenta que tuvo una buena experiencia, ya que le proporciono el dinero para el arrendamiento del terreno y los insumos necesarios, de lo que obtuvo una buena cosecha, con la que se ha mantenido hasta el momento con su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan so that he can invest in in the purchase of farming supplies. This loan will supplement his purchase of compost and herbicides, which will be applied to his corn and bean crops to prevent pests.

José said that his previous loan resulted in a good experience. The money was designated for the rent payment of the farmland and the purchase of necessary supplies, which enabled him to obtain a good harvest. He has been able to sustain his family thus far.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La socia Petrona continua dediandose a la venta de comida como pollo frito,arroz con pollo,papa a la huancaina entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,a la vez la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar adelante.
 
La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de insumos como arroz y aceite.

La socia se siente agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Petrona is a member who continues to sell food such as fried chicken, chicken with rice, Peruvian potato salad, and other dishes. She has been in business for many years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. At one time, she had a grocery store that she managed in order to help her family get ahead. Petrona is a responsible and industrious person who has the drive to continue moving forward. She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies, such as rice and oil.

Petrona is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as rice and oil.

loans.name: Octofianus

texts.en:
Octofianus is a 34-year-old man who is married to Yumima, a 32-year-old woman. They have been blessed with two children: Iga, who is 14 years old and in the second year of junior high school and Aurel, who is 5 years old and attending playgroup.

Octofianus used to work as a motor taxi driver but because of the insufficient income generated from the business, he then decided to run another business in poultry. He started the business last year by raising chicks for 28 days and reselling them. 

Octofianus only has a small cage, which is inadequate for accommodating thousands of chicks. Therefore, he submitted a loan application to TLM and requested a loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000 in order to purchase materials to enlarge the cage, as well as chicks’ fodder. 

Octofianus hopes to be successful in running the business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and chicks' fodder.

loans.name: Aby Stella

texts.es: Tal y como era el objetivo de su primer credikiva, Aby compró para su taller de confecciones, telas, hilos, botones, encajes y demás accesorios por volumen que le permitió tener un stock de inventario de materiales que utilizó en la elaboración de las prendas de vestir vendidas, además de ganar algunos descuentos en los almacenes donde compró.  Con el nuevo credikiva desea seguir invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para poder prepararse para las temporadas en las que la producción aumenta, como bien sabe Aby, por su vasta experiencia en el oficio de más de 20 años, la moda es cíclica y siempre hay nuevas tendencias, es por esto que desea satisfacer la demanda constante de su especial clientela.  Desea enviar un mensaje a sus fondeadores así: “Estoy muy agradecida por la ayuda recibida y la mejor manera de demostrarlo es cancelando puntualmente mi crédito.”
texts.en: Just as she had planned, Aby used her first CrediKiva loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, lace and other accessories in bulk so she could have an inventory of supplies to make clothing, while also obtaining discounts from the stores where she made her purchases.  With the new loan she wants to continue buying supplies to get ready for the high production seasons.  As Aby knows from her vast experience of 20 years, fashion is cyclical and there are always new trends.  So she always wants to be able to meet the demands of her special customers.  She wishes to send a message to all lenders, which is:  "I am very grateful for the help received and the best way of showing it is to make my loan payments on time."

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, lace and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Las Bolivianitas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “LAS BOLIVIANITAS” inicia su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por diez integrantes donde la señora Cristina es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: venta de plásticos, venta de utensilios del hogar, licorería, cerrajería, venta de frutas, tejido de mantas, venta de cosméticos ESIKA, venta de plantas de zapatos, orfebrería.
La señora Cristina cuenta que hace doce años que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto recibió capacitaciones; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de bebe, mismo que trabaja hace varios años aprendiendo el mismo de su amiga.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de ropa de bebe) los que comprarán de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijo.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta la capacitación y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Las Bolivianitas" is starting its second loan cycle as part of the Juan Pablo II Community Center. This group consists of 10 members and is led by Sra. Cristina as its president. The members have developed business activities that include selling plastics, selling household utensils, operating a liquor store, managing a locksmith shop, selling fruit, weaving blankets, selling Esika cosmetics, selling shoe soles, and working as a goldsmith.

Sra. Cristina joined a Communal Bank through Pro Mujer 12 years ago so that she could participate in the training classes. She currently has a business selling baby clothes. She learned the trade from a friend and has been in this line work for many years. The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying baby clothes at the fairs within the city of La Paz. These items will eventually be sold from her retail space. Working in this manner allows her to help her family move forward. Cristina is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Cristina said that she enjoys the training classes and the savings.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Oumar est un jeune transporteur  qui exerce depuis plus de 5 ans maintenant. I l possède un véhicule  qu’il aimerait réfectionner. Il  est marié et père de famille. Il a déjà eu 2 crédits à l’IMCEC et ce 3ème lui permettra  de faire la mutation, de changer les amortisseurs et les feux …Il entretien ses enfants et fait qu’ils ne manquent de rien car il les adore. 
Il aimerait acquérir d’autres véhicules pour augmenter son parc automobile car il ne connait que ce métier qu’il a hérité de son père ; Il sollicite l’appui de l’IMCEC pour cela.
texts.en:
Mr. Oumar is a young taxi driver who's been doing this job for more than five years now. He owns a car that he would like to refurbish.

He's married and the father of a family. He already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner, IMCEC, and this third loan will enable him to pay transfer fees, and replace the shock absorbers and the lights.

He takes care of his children and makes it so that they don't lack anything, because he loves them.

He would like to purchase other vehicles to expand his fleet since this job is all he knows. He inherited it from his father. This is why he's seeking support from IMCEC.

loans.use: to refurbish his 7 seat vehicle

loans.name: Hugo Alfredo

texts.es:
Hugo, se dedica a la venta de pan y otros productos que distribuye a sus clientes, él vive con su esposa e hijo de tres años de edad, desde hace 5 años está dedicado a la distribución de pan de la marca Sinaí, viaja tres veces por semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para el negocio, contando con la disponibilidad de dinero para realizar la compra de pan por mayor, y continuar distribuyendo a los clientes.
La aspiración de Hugo es mejorar en el negocio y comprarse su propio vehículo para la distribución, ya que actualmente usa el de su padre, para poderse superar junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Hugo makes a living selling bread and other products. He lives with his wife and son, aged three, and for five years has been distributing Sinaí brand bread, traveling three times a week.

Currently he is requesting a loan to buy products for his business.  The availability of funds will allow him to buy bread wholesale, so he can continue selling to his customers.

Hugo's goal is to improve his business and buy a distribution vehicle, since now he uses his father's, so he can help his family get ahead.

loans.use: To buy bread wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. María  tiene 24 años y es soltera con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 3 años y un bebe de 10 meses, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona Lozada, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de abarrotes por mayor para surtir su tienda, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir lo necesario, la Sra. María, ella pretende ampliar la gama de productos a vender y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de abarrotes como ser azúcar, fideos, arroz, etc.. su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable, que le genere más ingresos y le permita mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 24 years old, single, and has two children, a 3-year-old and a 10-month-old baby. She sells basic necessities from a neighborhood store located in the District of Lozada. This loan is her second cycle with Emprender. Sra. María will use this loan to buy groceries in bulk so that she can restock her store. Her reason for requesting this loan is that she does not have enough money to acquire what she needs. Sra. María intends to expand her range of products to sell and utilize the benefits of the loan to buy groceries such as sugar, noodles, rice, and other items.

Her wish for her business is that it be stable and profitable so that she can generate more income and have a better quality of life.
