Eang, age 54, is an entrepreneurial woman who has strong determination to aspire to something better for her family. She has a common-law relationship with her husband, who is also her business partner, and she has given birth to two children who are attending school and still need her support. 

Eang and her husband help each other in their farming business to ensure a standard of living and achieve their goal. In addition, Eang has operated a small store from her home and sells grocery items, spices, home use products, and soft drinks to satisfy her customers in the community. She wanted to increase the kinds of products she sells in her village, but she did not have enough capital to do it. In this connection, Eang wishes for a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy additional grocery items to sell in her store and increase her merchandise. She believes that with this loan, she will be able to develop her business. And she hopes that she can see her children grow up and finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Marieta

texts.en:
This is Maria Marietta, 40, resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Gerry, a traffic aid. She has two children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Maria Marietta operates a food stall. She sells snacks like fish balls, hotdog, fruits and other street food staples and also manage a small variety store in their community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 11, 000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of street food products and supplies she uses in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria Marietta dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of food supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is 38 years old, married and a mother of two sons and a daughter. Her sons do work while her daughter is studying.

Her husband is an auto mechanic. He has great technical skills and uses his skills very efficiently to provide quality auto repair services to his clients. Salma is also a working lady. She sells buffalo milk to her community clients. She also knows the art of sewing and sews if she receives any orders.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her dairy business. With the loan investment she will buy another buffalo that will help her get larger quantity of milk and increase her sales and profits. She is very experienced in her work and confident that her business will get more success by investing the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Salma.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es: Lilian es socia del Bancomunal Los Sauces de Compañía y tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ladrillos, negocio que comparte con su conviviente. Lo que mas le gusta de la institución es que le enseñaron a ahorrar y también las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal que son muy buenas ya que le enseñan a vivir mejor y saber invertir su dinero. Ella logró construir su horno para la fabricación de ladrillos. Está agradecida con FINCA Perú por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece. Su meta es tener una ferretería para que así pueda vender más de sus ladrillos entre otras cosas más. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de tierra para que así sigua produciendo más ladrillos.
texts.en:
Lilian is a member of the Bancomunal (community bank) "Los Sauces de Compañía," and she is 22 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 3 years, and is involved in making and selling bricks, a business she shares with her partner. What she likes best about the institution is how it has taught her how to save money, and also the workshops she receives at her community bank, which are very good and teach her to live better and know how to invest her money.

She was recently able to build a furnace for the manufacture of bricks. She is grateful to FINCA Peru for the loan options offered. Her goal is to have a hardware store so that she will be able to sell more of her bricks and other items. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of land in order to continue producing more bricks.

loans.use: to buy land in order to continue producing more bricks.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia continua en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ,ella vende lo que son productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche entre otros,la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia es una persona alegre y carismatica con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como leche.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Member Zoraida still works at her grocery store. She sells essential goods such as rice, sugar, milk, and other products. She has been in this business for years, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business. She is a cheerful and charismatic person and she is very eager to continue moving forward for her family.

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase merchandise for her business, such as milk.

She is grateful for the loan granted and is committed to complying with her installment plan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business, such as milk.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris lives in the coastal town of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has four children. Claris was employed and after saving some money, she added it onto the contribution from her husband as the startup capital for the current business. She now owns a food café which has been in operation for three years.
Claris was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined in order to access credit for her business. She is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase more charcoal and food stock for the café. Her aspiration is to open a restaurant in the near future.
Claris will use the additional income from this loan to purchase chairs for the café as part of her plan of expanding the sitting capacity of the café.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and food stock.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela es socia del Bancomunal Capuli y tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y es madre de tres hijos (dos hijos varones y una nena). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 8 años y se dedica a la venta de adornos y decoraciones en general sobre todo adornos navideños y también adornos para Semana Santa, y adicionalmente vende ropa. Ella dice que en todo este tiempo ha aprendido a ahorrar y sobre todo a compartir y ser solidaria que es lo que más aprecia de FINCA Perú. Su sueño para el futuro es construir una casa propia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio como adornos, decoraciones y ropa.
texts.en:
Gabriela, 31, is a member of Capuli Communal Bank.  She lives with her partner and is the mother of three children (two boys and a girl).  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for eight years and works selling a variety of ornaments and decorations, especially Christmas ornaments and decorations for Holy Week.  She also sells clothing.

She says that in all this time she has learned to save and to share and be supportive, which is what she appreciates most about FINCA Peru.  Her dream for the future is to build her own house.

She is going to invest the loan she is requesting in buying merchandise for her business, such as ornaments, decorations, and clothing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as ornaments, decorations, and clothing.

loans.name: Jose Denis

texts.es:
José continúa trabajando en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos plásticos, el cual son bien demandados, lo que está contento porque,  ha aumentado la cantidad en compra y venta, su esposa lo apoya, como objetivo  a futuro es tener su propio terreno y casa, viven a parte donde su suegro, ha hecho mejora al local que vive, pero su objetivo tener su propio terreno
Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá producto para su negocio 300 bultos de empaque para comida, 35 caja de platos desechables, 20 cajas de cucharas, 5 cajas de bolsa desechable y otros como, pajillas, servilletas, con el fin de seguir promoviendo su inversión, captando clientela y tener a sus clientes estables al entregarle mercadería.
texts.en:
José continues to work in his small business selling plastic products, which are in high demand, which pleases him, since he has increased the amount he is buying and selling.  His wife supports him, and his goal for the future is to have his own land and house.  They currently live on a piece of land where his father-in-law has made improvements to the place, but his goal to have his own land.

With this new loan, he will invest in products for his business, including 300 packages of food packaging, 35 boxes of disposable plates, 20 boxes of spoons, 5 boxes of disposable bags, and other products, such as straws and napkins, with the end goal of further developing his investment, attracting new customers and keeping his established customer base by delivering their merchandise.

loans.use: to invest in plastic products like plates, glasses, spoons, forks, and items for packaging foods.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El socio Porfirio, continua con su negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar y leche,el socio lleva buen tiempo con este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio , a la vez el socio continua trabajando en costruccion de diferentes obras que le solicitan , siendo de esta manera que le socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como arroz para su negocio.

El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas estbalecidas.
texts.en:
Member Porfirio is still in business selling essential goods, such as rice, sugar, and milk. He has been in this business for a good while and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into his business. At the same time, he continues to work different construction jobs that request him, which is how he provides for his family.

He is requesting the loan in order to purchase merchandise for his business, such as rice.

He is grateful for the loan granted and is committed to complying with his installment plan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his business, such as rice.

loans.name: Lesbia Lucrecia

texts.es: La señora lesbia Lucrecia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, el cual surgió como una necesidad de tener una herramienta de trabajo para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar  siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona responsable y que ha salido adelante con estos financiamientos. El crédito es para la compra de sabanas, cosméticos, ropa en general, lentes, gorras, ropa interior, entre otras cosas
texts.en: Lesbia Lucrecia works selling general merchandise, and has had her business for over seven years. It originated because she needed a means to work so that she could help cover expenses in her household. She has always been a responsible person and has got ahead through these financings. The loan is to purchase sheets, cosmetics, clothing in general, glasses, hats, underwear, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, cosmetics, clothing in general, glasses, hats, underwear, and other items.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: El señor Simón es un hombre de negocios, sabe bien lo quiere y eso es ampliar su negocio. El vende tortas en su carrito que es manipulado por una moto al frente, le va muy bien con la venta de tortas, además vende flautas y con este negocio da empleo a dos jóvenes, pero eso no es todo, también es carpintero y dice ser de los mejores. Lo vamos apoyar para que sus ingresos crezcan y su calidad de vida mejore.
texts.en:
Simón is a businessman who knows just what he wants, and that is to increase his business.  He sells tortas (traditional Mexican sandwiches) in his food cart, which is driven by a motor in the front.  Things are going very well for him in the sales of tortas.  

In addition, he sells flutes, and with this other business, he is able to employ two young men, but that's not all... also, he is a carpenter and said to be one of the best.  We hope you will support him so that his sales will increase and his quality of life can improve.

loans.use: to remodel his food cart.

loans.name: Loeung

texts.en:
Loeung is 49 years old, a resident of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is married but at present she has become a single mother of two school-aged children. She is a very hard-working mother who owns and manages a farming business to support the family and educate her children. She has been in this business for more than 24 years, earning approximately USD 4.50 each day.

Loeung wants to expand her business, but unfortunately she suffers from financial constraints. This is why she decided to request a loan of KHR 1,300,000 to hire laborers to take care of her potato crop and transplant her rice. She is very confident that this loan will allow her to earn higher profits and to offer a better future to her family. She plans to purchase extra plots of land to expand and increase her production in years to come.

loans.use: to hire laborers to take care of her potato crop and transplant her rice.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simon tiene 67 años de edad, conviviente y con 1 hijos, domicilia en el norte del Peru y solo cuenta con servicio de energía eléctrica. Simon se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería contando con 4,0 has de terreno agrícola sembrado de limón que cosecha semanalmente. Ademas su ganado tiene ovinos y credos, cuenta con mas de 12 años en su negocio, su conviviente lo apoya en sus actividades.

El tiene pensado invertir el prestamo en la compra de fertilizantes para cultivo de limón, ademas para realizar labores de limpieza del campo lo cual le permitirá lograr una mejor producción y  mejorar su calidad de vida. Simon es un cliente recurrente y ha demostrado ser muy responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Simon, 67, lives with a partner and has a child.  He resides in northern Peru, where the only utility he has is electricity.  Simon is a farmer who has 4 hectares of agricultural land that is planted with limes, which he harvests weekly.  He also raises livestock such as sheep and pigs.  He has been doing this work for more than 12 years, and his partner supports him in these activities.

He is planning on investing this loan in the purchase of fertilizers for his lime crops, and also to clear some of his land, which will allow him to increase his production and improve his quality of life.  Simon is a repeat client, and he has demonstrated himself to be very responsible with his payments.

loans.use: to improve the productivity of his crops through the purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
El socio Percy continua trabajando en su consultorio ya son varios años dedicandose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo,el socio es una persona empeñosa y carismatica siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia
El socio solicita el prestamo para el mantenimiento de su computadora.


El socio Percy está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Percy continues to work in his office, where he has been for many years, which has done very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  He is an earnest and charismatic person, and with this work he is able to help his family get ahead in life.

He is asking for this loan in order to do maintenance work on his computer.  Percy is glad of the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to service and upgrade his computer.

loans.name: Candida Azucena

texts.es: Cándida Azucena esta emprendedora tiene  por actividad económica servicio musicales ubicada en su casa de habitación la cual es contratado por los ciudadanos de su localidad, cándida ha tenido créditos anteriores con fundación la cual ha demostrado ser trabajadora, responsable, con solvencia de pago,  el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar
texts.en: Cándida Azucena is an entrepreneur whose business activity is offering music services from her home to locals in her city, who hire her. Cándida has received previous loans through our foundation and has proved herself to be hardworking, responsible, and solvent in her payments. She wants financing in order to purchase new music equipment so that she can offer her customers better service.

loans.use: to purchase new music equipment.

loans.name: Adolfina

texts.en:
Adolfina is a 53-year-old woman and is married to Samuel, who is 56 years old. They have six children between the ages of 27 and 14 years old. The children's names are: Septi, Nehemia, Oba, Jonas, Denny and Lena. Adolfina owns a coconut oil production business. The coconuts are taken from her farm and are processed to become coconut oil. The oil is then sold at the local market in her village; Friday is market day. She has to travel 25 kilometers to reach the market. Adolfina has been running the business for more than 10 years. The business is her main source of income as it enables her to cover her family's living costs and her children's school expenses.

At the moment, Adolfina has received many coconut oil orders but unfortunately she does not have a coconut rasping machine to speed up the production process. Adolfina has always produced the coconut oil by using traditional tools and it takes time to produce the oil. Therefore, Adolfina is requesting a loan of IDR5,000,000 to buy a new coconut rasping machine.

loans.use: to buy a new coconut rasping machine.

loans.name: Rasheedan's Group

texts.en:
Rasheedan has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s dairy business. With the loan investment he will buy another buffalo that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk for selling to his community clients and increase his sales and income. He has been operating his business for the past many years and Rasheedan is confident that the loan will be a productive one for him.

Rasheedan also provides full support to her husband in his business and takes care of the livestock. She gives them food on time and keeps their living place clean. She has given birth to seven children. All of them are enrolled in school and getting their education. Rasheedan knows the importance of education very well and wants her children to become successful in life by getting quality education.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Rasheedan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
Chay is 43 years old. He is married to a local farmer and was blessed with four single children who still need his support. He and his wife are raising their family in a peaceful village, in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. This couple plants and harvests particularly rice for their daily sustenance as well as for sale. Chay wants to sustain his business and make a stable income, so that he will be able to educate his children and give them a better life. 

Due to financial constraints, Chay is asking for a loan in the sum of KHR 1,000,000 in order to pay the labor costs incurred in plowing his soil. He believes that this loan will help him maintain a good growth of his business and he will have a fruitful harvest in the upcoming season.

loans.use: to pay the labor costs incurred in plowing his soil.

loans.name: Lkhagvesuren

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhagvasuren, 57, lives with his wife in a 'ger' (slum) district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They own a small wooden house and plot of land. His wife is a pensioner and looks after the house. Mr. Lkhagvasuren runs a small business which helps foreign citizens and tourists coming to Mongolia. He takes his clients around the city, showing all sights and places of interest using his car. He has been doing this business for a while and has a very good experience in guiding and transporting the clients. He is very reliable and a knowledgeable person.

Lkhagvesuren has an only daughter who is grown up and lives separately with her family. Lkhagvasuren loves his daughter very much and always helps and supports his daughter and her family financially and by whatever means he can. Recently his daughter bought an old house which needs some restoration. With the money borrowed from Credit Mongol, Lkhagvasuren wants to buy building materials such as insulation materials, bricks, wood planks, paint, cement, new plumbing pipes and make his daughter's house well insulated from the winter cold and more energy efficient by insulating it. As you know, Ulaanbaatar city is one of the coldest capital cities in the World. The money will be used to restore his only daughter’s old house and to make it more energy efficient and warm.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as insulation materials, bricks, wood planks, paint, cement, new plumbing pipes and to make his daughter's house well insulated from the winter cold and more energy efficient

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 27 años, es una mujer muy hacendosa que vive en una casa alquilada junto a su pareja Reynaldo, de 26 años, y su querido hijo Benjer de 2 años, a quien desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella se despierta, cada día, muy temprano para preparar los alimentos de su familia y luego se dirige a su puesto de ventas ubicado en el mercado de su localidad. Tiene un puesto de abarrotes y verduras, y gracias a su carisma y la amabilidad de su trato es la preferida por sus clientes, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras sabiendo de la gran variedad de productos que tiene su tienda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dialogar con sus clientes, lleva 2 meses en esta actividad, y a pesar del poco tiempo considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día. 

Con los 2,500 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará más mercaderías en arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas, verduras, pollo  y otros comestibles.
texts.en:
Delia, 27, is a very industrious woman who lives with her partner, Reynaldo, 26, and their dear son, Benjer, 2, in a rented house-they want to give their son a better quality of life.

Delia wakes up very early every day to prepare food for her family and then goes to her stand in the market where she lives.  She has a stand for groceries and vegetables and thanks to her charisma and congeniality in the way she treats her customers, they will always buy from her knowing that she has a big variety of products.  What she likes most about her work is chatting with her customers.  She has had this business for 2 months and despite the short time she has had it, she considers the most difficult part to be having to stand on her feet all day.

She will use the 2500 new sols requested to buy more merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, canned goods, vegetables and more food.

loans.use: to buy more food to stock her stand

loans.name: Moun

texts.en:
As a responsible mother, Moun operates a farming business to generate income. She is 29 years old and has two school-aged children, residing with her family in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. The farming business is the main source of the family’s income, which she uses for her daily food and allowances for her children. 

Moun aims to improve her farming business, make it more profitable, and reduce some unnecessary costs incurred in her business. Consequently, she is requesting a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to purchase two cows for farming purposes. She believes that the loan will help her to increase her income if she strives to work harder. She wants to use the generated income for the future expansion of her business and for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for farming purposes.

loans.name: Mirjael Jonatan

texts.es:
Mirjael tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente y sin Hijos. Vive en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en el norte del pais en donde practica sus actividades de ganadería. El se especializa en la crianza de ovinos, porcino y aves de corral, los cuales criá engorda y comercializa en el mercado local. Ademas, se dedica a labores agrícolas, su madre lo apoya en sus actividades y se dedica a la agricultura.

El destino del crédito será la compra de alimentos para el engorde de ganado y ademas para compra de ganado para el engorde y venderlos a un mejor precio en el mercado local. El cuenta con mas de 6 años en su negocio y previamente ha utilizado los servicios del Edpyme Alternativa con el apoyo de Kiva.
texts.en:
Mirjael is 25 years old, lives with his partner, and has no children. He lives in his own house, which is located in the northen region of the country, where he works raising livestock. He specializes in raising sheep, pigs, and fowl, which he raises, fattens, and sells at the local market. He also does agricultural work. His mother supports him in his business and works in agriculture.

The loan will be used to purchase feed to fatten his animals and also to purchase livestock to be fattened and sold at the local market at a better price. He has over six years of experience in his business and has previously used the services of Edpyme Alternativa with Kiva's support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock.

loans.name: Nhes' Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Nhes is aged 50 years old and married. He has three children, two of whom are dependent on the family and still in school. To support the family, Nhes and his wife earn a living as rice farmers in the village and they have been involved in this business for almost thirty years. To better support his family, he also is a local TV and cassette player mechanic. 

Nhes’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and he is a second-loan client while his group member is with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for the first time. The first loan from VisionFund has helped Nhes's family better support their daily lives and children’s studies. With his current business, he is able to earn around 18,000 KHR per day. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Nhes, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes to make more rice and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, age 37, is a loving mother who is responsible for two teenaged children that are enrolled at school. Chea pays her full attention to her farming business, generating the income to support the family. Usually, she grows rice, potatoes, beans, and various kinds of vegetables based on the season and the needs of the marketplace. She has been engaged in this type of business for almost 10 years with a great support from her helpful husband. 

With the loan of KHR 1,500,000, Chea would like to pay for labor costs. She will hire the laborers to take out all unwanted plants from the potato field and take care of her crops. This will be her first loan, which will help Chea in improving her business. She is confident she will pay her loan back punctually with her generated income. She is very thankful to the kind lenders.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng, aged 51, is a married mother of nine children, four of whom are dependent children and some of whom are still in school. Heng and her husband are farmers who have been farming rice and planting cassava for ten years to support the big family. With the current business, she can earn around 17,000 KHR per day to spend for daily basic needs. 

This is Heng’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she and three other members are second cycle clients while the other one is just with VisionFund this loan cycle. She has used the first loan from VisionFund successfully and she can better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Heng, who is the leader, will use her portion to purchase fertilizers and use a portion of it to buy gasoline for her pumping machine to carry water into her rice field. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully and increase crop yields to earn more income so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and gasoline for her pumping machine

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 53-year-old married woman. Her husband, Paulus, is 63 years old. They have three children: Margaretha, a 21-year-old married woman; Gabriel, 13 years old; and Agustina, 14 years old. Both Gabriel and Agustina are in the third grade of junior high school.

Besides being a housewife, Paulina also runs a fish distribution business to the traditional market in another district. She works with her daughter and her son-in-law.

Paulina is seeking this loan to expand the business; specifically, she requested a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 IDR from TLM. She plans to spend the loan proceeds on more fish and to cover distribution costs. Paulina is hoping that she can provide a better life for her family as a result of the requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and to cover distribution costs.

loans.name: Say's Group

texts.en:
Married with four children, Say is 45 years old and resides in a rural village of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She still cares for three dependent children, who are all in school.

Rice farming and cassava planting is the main source of her family’s income. She has been in this business for twenty years. The main challenge for her is the lack of working capital to support her business.

Say is in her sixth loan cycle, while her group is the second cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Her group has successfully repaid prior loans via VisionFund. Having been with VisionFund for five loan cycles, Say is now better able to support her family. With VisionFund's assistance, she now earns approximately 18,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save approximately 8,000 KHR per day. She is now leading her group in applying for a loan in the amount of 500,000 KHR each (1,000,000 KHR total). Say, who is the group leader, will use her portion of the requested loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her business and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
SAUL TIENE 24 AÑOS, ES CONVIVIENTE,  Y CONOCIDO EN EL MEDIO, POR SU LABOR DE SERVICIO DE TRANSPORTE PUBLICO MOTOTAXI. VIVE CON SU CONYUGE QUE ESTA EMBARASADA DE 4 MESES EN UNA CASA HUBICADA AL NORTE DEL PAIS. 

EL SE DEDICA AL SERVICIO DE TRANSPORTE PUBLICO DE MOTOTAXI DESDE HACE 3 AÑOS EN SU REGION.CON EL CRÉDITO REALIZARA CAMBIO DE LLANTAS A SU VEHICULO (MOTOTAXI) Y ARRASTE PARA SU MEJOR USO PARA USO PARA BRINDAR UN BUEN SERVICIO, ADEMAS DEL ARREGLO DE SU DOMICILIO (CUARTOS) PARA UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA.  EL ES UNA PERSONA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS. FAMILIA UNIDA Y ESTE ESFUERZO ES PRECISAMENTE EL REFLEJO DE LAS NECESIDADES QUE AFRONTARA SU FAMILIA CUANDO NASCA EL BEBE. VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA.
texts.en:
Saul is 24 years old, and is in a common-law marriage. He is known in his area for his work in public transportation services by mototaxi. He lives with his wife, who is four months pregnant, in a house located in the northern region of the country.

He has been working in public transportation services by mototaxi for three years in his region. He will use the loan to change the tires and the hauling system on his vehicle (mototaxi) so that it works better and he can offer a good service, as well as to fix up his home (bedrooms) for a better quality of life. He has good references and has a close family. Actually, this effort is in anticipation of the needs his family will face once the baby is born.

He lives in a community where there is trade, agriculture, and stockbreeding.

loans.use: to change the tires and hauling system on his vehicle (mototaxi).

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is the owner of a store where she sells all kinds of agricultural products. She has worked in this business for more than 20 years, so she already has a loyal customer base that consistently buys products from her.

Masika explains that she is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person with great hopes of progressing and getting ahead in life.

She is requesting this loan to buy fruit, vegetables, and more supplies to stock her business. In this way, she will be able to offer high-quality products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 33, is married and has 2 children. The children are Immanuel (3) and Rahel (2). Maria assists her husband in generating income for their family by working as a soil digger. The soil then is sold to the bricks maker.

Besides working as a soil digger, Maria is planning to increase the income generated by initiating a catfish business. She is planning to build a pond and prepare the catfish seedlings. Maria is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 to establish a permanent pond and to buy the catfish seedlings.

loans.use: to establish a permanent pond for catfish and to buy the seedlings.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 35 años, tiene una hija, con ella viven en la casa de su hermana, ubicada en el pueblo de Sicaya. 
Ella está al cuidado de sus cinco sobrinos, quienes quedaron huérfanos, y junto a su familia se apoyan en la crianza de los mismos. “Toda la tarde me dedicó a ellos, somos lo único que tienen”, afirma. Con ese inmenso corazón y ganas de salir adelante, hace 2 años fue contratada en la gobernación de su localidad para realizar la limpieza durante toda la mañana. Por las tardes, desde hace 2 años, mientras cuida de sus sobrinos, cría cuyes, ahora ya tiene 150 ejemplares, también siembra la alfalfa para alimentarlos. Su deseo es ampliar su galpón, pues cada 4 meses aumenta la producción, los cuales vende a los carniceros de su localidad.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “La vecindad” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores ocasiones. Y le agrada ser parte de su grupo porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Mercedes invertirá el dinero solicitado en la mejora de su galpón de cuyes, hará una ampliación para poder separarlos según la raza.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 35, has a daughter.  They live in her sister's house in the town of Sicaya.  She takes care of her five orphaned nieces and nephews, and she and her family support each other in raising them.  "I devote every afternoon to them.  We're all they have," she says.

With her immense heart and a desire to get ahead, two years ago she was hired by her town's government to do the cleaning in the morning.  For the past two years she has raised guinea pigs while taking care of her nieces and nephews in the afternoon.  Currently she has 150 of them.  She also grows alfalfa to feed them.  She wants to expand her shed because every four months she increases her production, which she sells to the butchers in her town.

She belongs to La Vecindad Solidarity Group and this is her third loan with MFP.  She promises to make her payments on time as on previous occasions.  It pleases her to be part of her group because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.

Mercedes is going to invest the requested money in improving her guinea pig shed.  She will expand it to be able to separate them by breed.

loans.use: to expand her guinea pig shed.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is married with five children. She has had a grocery store in her home for one year. It is well stocked. Mwanakombo is a very hard-working person, eager to succeed and help her family, as she knows that life is hard and working is the only way to get ahead. She is applying for a loan in order to buy soft drinks, dairy products, candy, and other stock to supply her business and to continue providing good products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, dairy products, candy, and other stock for her business.

loans.name: Kimrat's Group

texts.en:
Kimrat is a 44-year-old widow living in a rural village located in the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She has two children. One of her children, her daughter, helps with her business.

As a widow, she earns a living through rice-farming and raising pigs. To earn more income to better support her family, she sells grocery items, and sometimes she works for others for pay. She has been in this business for nearly 27 years.

Kimrat’s group consists of two members, both of whom have been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. The prior loans have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for another loan with VisionFund in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each (2,000,000 KHR total). As the leader, she wants to use her loan portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to use a portion of it to buy more grocery items for her store. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her business and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her farmland and grocery items for her store

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 50-year-old married woman with five children. Her husband is a fisherman.

To earn a living, Elizabeth sells home-cooked meals to her community. She also makes fruit salad, which she sells to her community. She works hard to help provide for her family's basic needs. Elizabeth also plans to make improvements to her family's house.

She is seeking this loan to purchase meat, vegetables, fruit, spices and other ingredients. With the loan proceeds, she hopes to increase her income and to achieve her future goals.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat, vegetables, fruit, spices and other ingredients

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 39 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 

Melodina is engaged in the teaching profession and earns approximately PHP 12,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to finance the processing of papers for her husband to go abroad. 

Melodina has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Melodina hopes to engage in business.

loans.use: To finance the processing of her husband's papers to go abroad

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 42-year-old father of three children: Sonya, nine years old, is in the third grade of elementary school; Donita is five years old; and Maria is three years old.

Nelson covers his family's living expenses by selling wood planks for the construction and furniture businesses. Nelson usually buys raw materials and then processes them into wooden planks. He has run this business for years, and it has become the main source of income for his family.

At the moment, the demand for wood planks and boards is increasing, but because of the limitations in his working equipment, Nelson finds it hard to meet his customers' demands. Therefore, Nelson is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000,000 IDR. He would like to use the loan proceeds to purchase an electric saw, a wood plane, and timber.

loans.use: to purchase an electric saw, a wood plane, and additional timber.

loans.name: Khoeur's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Khoeur is 53 years old and married. She has six children, four of whom are dependent on her and a few of them work as workers in Thailand to support the family. The only source of her family’s income is from rice farming on a six-hectare farmland, some of which she rents from other villagers. She has been in this business for several years. 

Khoeur received her first loan with VisionFund three cycles ago and she successfully repaid the loans. Now, she and her two group members who have been with VisionFund for two loan cycles have applied for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for leased farmland. She hopes to make more rice and sell it at a good price so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for leased farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Thona

texts.en:
Thona, aged 27, is a married mother of one small dependent daughter and lives in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Her family’s main income is from rice farming and cassava planting which she has been doing for five years to make a living and she can make a daily income of around 17,000 KHR per day from her current business. 

This is the second loan for Thona with VisionFund and she completely paid back the first loan. Now requesting a loan of 800,000 KHR with VisionFund, she will use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to set aside some money to afford to purchase a hand tractor for her farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Munga

texts.en:
Munga is married and he has 4 children. He runs a very well-supplied small store, and he is a very hard-working and tenacious man always making efforts to get ahead in life.

Munga told us he started working in this field more than 5 years ago because there was a need for a general store in his neighborhood, and little by little he has been able to grow thanks to his job.

He is requesting a loan to buy more general products such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, oil and baked products. Thanks to this investment he will keep on selling high quality products, consequently increasing his sales and his income.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, flour, sugar, oil and baked products.

loans.name: Nhor's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of three children, Nhor is aged 37, residing in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice and planting maize as the main source of her family’s income for more than ten years. The current business earns her about 7,000 KHR per day and this has made her encounter a lack of working capital. 

This is the second loan for Nhor’s group with VisionFund and they successfully paid back the first loan. After her first loan with VisionFund, she is confident that she will gradually improve her living. To solve the challenge, she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her business and increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for farmland and spend for labor

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Teuy's Group

texts.en:
Teuy is a 60-year-old married woman. She has six children, two of whom depend on her and live with her family.

She is a rice farmer, while her husband is a paid worker in the village. She has been in this business for 20 years, and she typically earns a daily income of approximately 16,000 KHR from her business operations. The main challenge of her family’s business is the lack of working capital.

Teuy has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles, while her group members have been with VisionFund for one to five cycles. She successfully repaid the prior loans, which helped her to better support both her family and her business. To address her business challenges, she is leading her group of four to apply for another loan with VisionFund in the amount of 500,000 KHR each (2,000,000 KHR total). As the leader, she plans on using her portion of the loan proceeds to purchase fertilizers and to plow her land. She hopes to grow more rice and to thereby earn additional income so that she can afford to buy a new television for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to plow her land

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Mongkol Borey district of Banteay Manchey province, Pov is a 45-year-old married woman.

She earns a living by raising pigs, while her husband is a paid worker to support the family. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Before she received prior loans, she encountered numerous problems and coped with difficult living conditions. This would be the fourth loan for Pov’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. They successfully repaid prior loans with VisionFund. Those prior loans helped her to better support her family. Now she is able to earn approximately 20,000 KHR per day to spend on her family's basic living expenses. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. Pov plans on using her portion of the loan proceeds to purchase more pigs and feed for her pigs. She hopes to fatten up her pigs and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs and feed.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with two children in school. She lives in Tiribe, Kenya, where her house has electricity and piped water.

Catherine has operated a small kiosk out of her house for the past three years, but she has also sells vegetables as an additional source of income.

Catherine wants to enlarge her kiosk and to have a functioning fast food counter so that she can continue to provide for her children. As such, she is requesting this loan to buy rice, flour, sugar, tea leaves, and other goods to sell from her kiosk. She and her family appreciate the assistance that they're receiving from Kiva.

loans.use: to expand her kiosk by purchasing rice, flour, sugar, tea leaves, and other goods

loans.name: June Gee

texts.en:
June Gee is married with 2 children. She is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines.

June Gee is a farmer and she manages a banana production as well as a flowering business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years and every month she earns 3,800 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,400 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

June Gee been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, she hopes to see the studies of her children finished.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en:
Sarin is a 49-year-old married woman with five children. She still cares for three of her children.

To make a living, she raises pigs, while her husband is a taxi driver. She has been in this business for 15 years. She typically earns approximately 20,000 KHR per day to spend on her family’s living expenses, and she saves approximately 10,000 KHR each day.

Sarin successfully repaid her first loan via VisionFund, the proceeds of which she used to better support her family. This would be the second loan for Sarin’s group of two. Specifically, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each (2,000,000 KHR total). Sarin, who is the leader, would use her portion of the loan proceeds to buy three piglets and feed for her pigs. With this loan, she hopes to fatten up her pigs and to thereby generate more income to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and additional feed

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 56 years old.  She is married and lives in a small village in the Terjola District with her husband, Bezhan, and her 24-year-old son.  

Bezhan is a pensioner and her son works in construction, earning a service fee for his work.  However, the family primarily earns a living through agricultural activities.  They have two milking cows and a calf.  They produce cheese and sell it on the local open market. They also own a plot of land, where greens are grown and a vineyard is located.  Bezhan and his son make wine in the autumn and sell it in nearby villages.  The family’s total average monthly income is 500 Lari.
 
Natela has requested a loan in order to purchase an additional dairy cow and a piglet.  With this purchase, she will be able to increase her milk production and make more cheese.  In addition, she will raise and fatten the piglet, selling it in winter when the prices are high.  These activities will increase the family’s income.  

She plans to invest the profit in the family agricultural business, expanding it and making it more profitable over time.  Taking everything into account, Natela expects the family’s living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and a piglet.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 50 años, su esposo es Cornelio, de 46 años, con el que tuvo tres hijos, ya mayores e independiente. Lo que más desea ahora es tener una vejez tranquila.

Desde muy joven empezó a ganarse la vida trabajando de distintas formas. Pero desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y su puesto del mercado de su localidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre las prendas que mejor le queden, ya que de esta manera se distrae y fideliza a sus compradores. Marcelina utiliza los préstamos de MFP para comprar mercadería y aumentar su stock.

Con los 1,500 nuevos soles de este crédito viajará a Lima (capital), para adquirir más ropa, de preferencia liviana, ya que su zona es de selva, muy caliente.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 50, and her husband Cornelio, 46, had three children, now grown and on their own.  What she most wants now is to have a peaceful old age.

When she was very young she began to earn a living working in various ways, but for five years she has sold clothing in a stall in the market of her town.  What she likes most about her job is advising her customers about the garments that look best on them, because this way she amuses herself and cultivates the loyalty of her buyers.  Marcelina uses the MFP loans to buy merchandise and increase her stock.

With this loan of 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN], she will travel to Lima (the capital) to acquire more clothing, preferably light because she lives in the very hot jungle area.

loans.use: to travel to the capital to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es:
Jose tiene 68 años de edad, viudo y vive en casa propia con 1 hijo. La actividad que desarrolla el es la agricultura contando con 2,0 hectareas de terreno agrícola, sembrado de limón en producción que cosecha semanalmente. El ha contado con este negocio por mas de  20 años.

El destino del crédito será la compra de fertilizantes para cultivo de limón, esta inversión le permitirá lograr una mejor producción y vender a un precio mejor sus productos, esto le permitira mejorar su calidad de vida. A pesar de su edad, jose tiene muchas ganas de trabajar y este prestamo es una muestra de que esta pensando en el futuro.
texts.en:
José, 68, is a widower and he lives in his own house with one child.  The work he does is agriculture.  He has two hectares of farmland, growing lemons that he harvests weekly.  He has had this business for more than 20 years.

The loan will be to buy fertilizer for growing lemons.  This investment will allow him to have a better crop and sell his products at a better price.  This will allow him to improve his quality of life.  Despite his age, José really wants to work, and this loan indicates that he is thinking about the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow lemons and improve his sales competitiveness.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 25 años, es madre soltera, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su querida hija Hayddi, de 3 años, a quien desea brindarle un mejor futuro.

Su negocio es una tienda de comestibles, tiene un lugar en el mercado de su localidad, y su puesto es el más concurrido porque es el primero en abrir y el último en cerrar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre la calidad y variedad de cada producto, lleva 3 meses en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su tienda, pues de eso dependen sus ingresos económicos.

Con los 1,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará más provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes (sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche y otros productos).
texts.en:
María, 25, is a single mother.  She lives in a rented house with her beloved daughter Hayddi, 3, whom she wants to give a better future.

Her business is a grocery store.  She has a place in the market of her town and her stall is the busiest because it's the first one to open and the last to close.  What she most likes about her job is advising her customers about the quality and variety of each product.  She has done this work for three months and she considers the most difficult thing to be staying in her store all day because her income depends on it.

With this loan of 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN], she will buy more provisions for her grocery store (bags of rice, sugar, milk, and other products).

loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply her store.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 57 años, vive en la casa que compró gracias a su trabajo, junto a sus cuatro hijos, quienes ya son mayores de edad.
Su trabajo es la venta de bebidas y platos típicos de la zona. Esta actividad la realiza con el apoyo de personas quienes se encargan de la atención a los clientes. Y lo considera muy rentable, sobre todo los fines de semana cuando acuden mucho más personas en busca de probar los exquisitos platos típicos que prepara. Para más adelante, desea ampliar su local y que sus clientes estén mucho más cómodos. Pero lo que prioriza ahora es mejorar el mobiliario que tiene.

Una vez más se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le brinda MFP, ya que así está segura de avanzar con su labor. Asimismo, le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque trabaja con personas muy responsables.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará mesas y sillas para acondicionar mejor el local de su restaurante.
texts.en:
María, 57, lives with her four children, who are already adults, in the house she bought thanks to her job.

Her job is selling beverages and traditional dishes of the area.  She does this work with the help of people who are responsible for serving the customers.  She considers it very profitable, especially on the weekend when many more people come to try the delicious traditional dishes she makes.  She wants to expand her place in the future so her customers will be much more comfortable.  But her priority now is to improve her furniture.

Once more she is grateful for the financial support that MFP gives her, because this way she is certain of making progress in her work.  It also pleases her to be part of her communal bank because she works with very responsible people.

With this loan of 3,000 nuevos soles [PEN], she will buy tables and chairs to better equip her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is married and has six children.  She is 42 years old and lives in Carangan, Ozamis City. 

Andrea sells cooked sweet corn to earn a living and she has been in business for one year.  Andrea earns 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP in order to purchase additional young corn to sell. 

Andrea has been a member of GDMPC since 2007.  In the future, Andrea hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional young corn to sell.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is 57 years old. She lives in a small village of Kaspi district with her family: her husband, Elguja, and 25-year-old son. 

Her husband and son work on construction and get service fees for their work. Dali runs an agricultural business. She has two milking cows and produces dairy food: cheese, curds, and yogurt. Dali sells the dairy food in nearby villages. Also, she works on a poultry farm and gets a salary. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Lari. 
  
Dali requested a loan for purchasing calves. She will grow the calves and sell them after several months with a price mark-up. 

As a result of the above mentioned activities, the income of the family will increase. With the increased amount of profit, she will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable. Dali hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Melinde

texts.en:
Melinde is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Melinde  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages. 

Melinde has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, and beverages.

loans.name: Djromahuton 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJROMAHUTON 1 est composé de cinq personnes qui habitent le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mawudo Conforte est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mawudo Conforte est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Mawudo Conforte est mariée à un certain Franck. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mawudo Conforte vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Mawudo Conforte vend des condiments à son domicile. Mawudo Conforte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mawudo Conforte sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON 1, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The group DJROMAHUTON 1 is made up of five people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Mawudo Conforte, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. Mawudo Conforte is 34 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a man named Franck. The couple has four dependent children in school.  Together, they ensure all the household needs are met. To meet the needs of the family, Mawudo Conforte sells condiments at her home. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. To increase customer satisfaction, sales, and income, she along with the rest of the DJROMAHUTON 1 group are requesting their first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy various condiments to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is married to a businessman. They have four children who all attend school. Dorcas has a shop in Tiribe, Kenya where she sells beverages and various candies. She started her business several years ago, selling her products from her home and continued to do so until she bought a shop with the help of her savings. Today she is well-known in the town and people work in the small, centralized area where her shop is located. Dorcas is a responsible person who has the drive to succeed. She also possesses a jovial and enterprising spirit. There is no doubt that she can accomplish all of the goals she has set for herself. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sodas, candies, and other items in order to restock her business and continue offering variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy sodas, candies, and other items.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas es socia del Bancomunal Ccori Ayllu y tiene 38 años de edad, es convivientes y  es madre de 5 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 8 años y de dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, cerdo) y también se dedica a la venta de cereales.  Está feliz de pertenecer a su Bancomunal ya que ahí conoció amigas con las que comparte momentos inolvidables y sobre todo recibe capacitaciones  con las que aprende mucho, gracias a eso ahora sabe cómo invertir adecuadamente su dinero. Su meta es brindarles una educación superior a sus hijos para que puedan ser profesionales y está muy segura que lo logrará.  El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra  de animales menores, cereales, alimentos para los animales.
texts.en:
38-year old Felicitas is a member of the Ccori Ayllu Community Bank. She is married and has five children. She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for 8 years and earns her living by raising and selling animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. She also sells cereal crops.

Felicitas is happy to belong to her community bank since she has made friends there, women with whom she shares unforgettable moments. She also receives training there and learns much. Because of these classes she knows how to invest her money appropriately.

Her goal is to have her children go to college so they can get good jobs--she is sure that she will be able to attain this goal. The loan that Felicitas is seeking will be used to buy young animals, cereals, and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy young animals, cereals, and animal feed

loans.name: Epifanía

texts.es: Epifanía es socia del Bancomunal Ccori Ayllu, tiene 40 años de edad, y es madre soltera de 8 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y se dedica a la venta de quesos los cuales lleva a vender a la selva y también se dedica a la venta de comida, ella da comida a crédito a un grupo de trabajadores de una empresa de telefonía. Ella dice que aprendió mucho con las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ya que ahora sabe ahorrar e invertir de manera adecuada su dinero. Está agradecida con la institución por que les ofrece facilidades de préstamo a las mujeres de escasos recursos económicos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de quesos al por mayor par que pueda incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
40-year old Epifanía is a member of the Ccori Ayllu Community Bank. She is a single mother with eight children. She’s been a member of FINCA Peru for three years and earns her living selling cheese to people living in the rainforest. She also sells meals on credit to a group of workers at a telephone company.

Epifanía says that she has learned a lot from the training that she receives at her community bank. She now knows how to save money and spend it appropriately. She is grateful to the institution for providing easy credit terms to women who have few financial  resources. 

Epifanía plans to use the loan money to buy cheese at wholesale prices so that she can grow her business.

loans.use: to buy cheese at wholesale prices

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina tiene 52 años, está casada con Amadeo, de 56 años, y con él tiene cinco  hijos, quienes aun son estudiantes.  
Desde hace 13 años tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende los comestibles básicos para le hogar, tales como: carnes, verduras, conservas, menestras, condimentos, etc. Su tienda está implementada en su vivienda y cuanta con la ayuda de sus hijos, que es lo que más le gusta, estar rodeada de sus seres queridos, eso la motiva a seguir laborando para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Comenta que los ingresos de sus ventas le sirven para incrementar su mercadería, pero aun necesita más para poder solventar todos los gastos escolares de sus hijos.

Cuando Marina supo de los créditos que ofrecía MFP, no dudó en aceptar la invitación para ser parte de un banco comunal, el cual se llama “Santa Teresita”. 
Con los 4,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo se abastecerá de mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Marina is 52 years old and married to Amadeo, age 56. They have five children, all of whom are students.

For the past 13 years, Marina has managed a grocery store where she sells basic food products for the home such as meat, vegetables, preserves, dried vegetables, condiments, and other items. Her store is located in her house and she has the help of her children. What she enjoys most is being around her loved ones. This motivates her to continue working so that they can have a better quality of life. Marina says that the revenue from her sales helps to increase her inventory of merchandise, but she needs to acquire more in order to cover all of the school expenses for her children.

When Marina learned about the loans from MFP, she did not hesitate to accept the invitation to join a Communal Bank. She is part of the group called "Santa Teresita". This loan of 4,000 PEN will be used to restock her grocery store with merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ayidokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOKPO est composé de trois personnes qui pratiquent leurs activités dans le même endroit. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Julienne Assiba est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Julienne Assiba est âgée de 48 ans et vit au Bénin. Julienne Assiba a très peu fréquenté l’école. Julienne Assiba ne vit plus avec son mari. Julienne Assiba est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins, Julienne Assiba vend des friperie, des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et de la bouillie de maïs. Julienne Assiba s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Julienne Assiba sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOKPO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The AYIDOKPO group is comprised of three people who work out of the same location. Julienne Assiba is the group representative, and is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Julienne Assiba is 48 and lives in Benin. Julienne Assiba rarely attended school. Julienne Assiba no longer lives with her husband. Julienne Assiba is the mother of four children, all of whom are to school. In order to meet the needs of her children and to take care of their expenses, Julienne Assiba sells secondhand clothes, mobile phone top up cards, and hominy grits. Julienne Assiba buys her supplies in a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clients and in order to grow her sales and her income, Julienne Assiba, along with the other members of the AYIDOKPO group, is asking for a second loan with ALIDé. The first loan they received was repaid.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone top up cards and secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Tegal Sari Group

texts.en:
In the disbursement of the loan, all members were present and they chose a new head of the group. Ni Ketut was elected as the head. 

She got 1,500,000 IDR used to buy two superior quality pigs for fattening. She chose them for the higher selling price later. 

She and her family already feel the benefits from raising pigs. In addition to their financial advantage, they also have organic fertilizers from pig manure. They use it to fertilize the plants in the garden in order to produce better. 

Ni Ketut gratefully acknowledges the assistance already received. She hopes all goes well and that she will be successful

loans.use: to buy two superior quality pigs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 48 años, hace 23 años enviudó. Desde entonces ha cuidado sola a sus hijos, ahora vive con los dos últimos.
Ella es una mujer muy alegre; su carisma y simpatía le han ayudado a obtener la clientela que tiene para su tienda. Otra ventaja es la zona donde se ubica su negocio, está en el centro del poblado; además que también ofrece verduras y carne. Ella se esfuerza cada día para obtener todos los productos que necesitan sus clientes, “cuando un cliente ingresa a mi tienda, me aseguro de que compre algo y no se retire con las manos vacías”, afirma. Por eso se siente feliz, ya que obtiene buenas ganancias que le permiten sostener a sus hijos. 

Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y espera concretar sus planes con este apoyo financiero. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores ocasiones. Y además le agrada ser parte de su grupo porque todos los integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Rosa invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old, and has been widowed for 23 years. Since then, she has raised her children alone and now lives with the last two.  She is a very happy woman; her charisma and friendliness have helped her to obtain the customers that [shop] at her store.  Another advantage [Rosa has] is the area where her business is located; it is in the center of the town and also offers vegetables and meat.  She strives every day to obtain all the products that her customers need. "When a customer enters my store, I make sure that they buy something and that they don't leave with empty hands," she says.  For that reason, she feels happy since she earns good profits that enable her to support her children.  

This is [her] third loan with MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma] and she hopes to turn her plans into a reality with this financial support.  She promises to make her payments on time as on previous occasions.  It pleases her to be part of her group because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.    Rosa will invest the requested money in the purchase of staple products to restock her store with groceries.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in order to restock her store.

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUGNON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sourou Olivette Berthe est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sourou Olivette Berthe est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Sourou Olivette Berthe est mariée à un certain Symphorien. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sourou Olivette Berthe vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Sourou Olivette Berthe vend depuis huit ans, du charbon de bois à son domicile. Sourou Olivette Berthe s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sourou Olivette Berthe sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MAHOUGNON group is comprised of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Sourou Olivette Berthe, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. 

Sourou Olivette Berthe is 37 years old and lives in Benin. Sourou Olivette Berthe is married to Symphorien. The couple has three dependent children who go to school. Sourou Olivette Berthe lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple takes care of the household expenses. 

In order to take care of the family expenses, Sourou Olivette Berthe has been selling wood coal out of her home for eight years. Sourou Olivette Berthe buys her supplies in Benin. 

With the goal of satisfying her clients and growing her sales and revenue, Sourou Olivette Berthe, along with the other members of the MAHOUGNON group, is asking for a third loan with ALIDé. Their previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of wood coal.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 34 años, vive en compañía de su esposo, Jesús, y sus tres hijos, a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Rundo. 
Es agricultora, pero no cuenta con terrenos propios, por ello alquila, de manera anual, las tierras donde siembra papa, maíz, alverja y otros productos según la temporada. Su esposo le ayuda en los trabajos duros que requiere el campo y ella también se dedica al cuidado de sus 10 vacas, de los cuales entrega de 30 a 35 litros de leche diaria a una empresa de lácteos. Pero como le gustan los animales, también cría cerdos y ovejas, los que engorda y de manera eventual, sólo cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica, los vender a los ganaderos de la zona. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Rundo al progreso” y este su crédito número 8 con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo financiero recibido durante todo este tiempo. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, y además le agrada pertenecer a su grupo porque las personas son responsables y solidarias.
María invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de maíz y papa, además del pago del alquiler de su terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old and lives with her husband, Jesus, and their 3 children, whom they care for in their own house, located near Rundo. 

Maria is a farmer but lacks farm land of her own. So, she rents fields, on an annual basis, where she sows potatoes, corn, green peas, and other crops according to season. Her husband helps her with the hard work the country labor requires. Maria also cares for her 10 cows, who produce 30 to 35 liters of milk daily for a milk enterprise. Since she likes animals, she also raises pigs and sheep, fattening them and, eventually, only when there is the need, she sells them to the ranchers of the zone.

Maria belongs to the “[Rumbo] al Progreso” [Direction of Progress] communal bank. This is her 8th loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the financial help received during all this time. Maria promises to be punctual in making her payments. She is also happy to belong to her group because the people are responsible and supportive.

Maria will invest this money in purchasing natural fertilizers to spread among her corn and potato plants, and she will pay the rent on her agricultural lands.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and pay the rent for her agricultural lands.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a widow with two children. She is 63 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Anecita owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for eight years and earns PHP 9,823 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase farm chemicals. 

Anecita has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2007. In the future, Anecita's plan is to save her returns in order to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is a 24-year-old man from Gaza. He is married and has two young boys.  He has owned a bookstore for selling books, gifts, and stationary since January 1st 2010.  Jameel has asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a photocopier and some materials for the store.

His aim and future ambition is to enlarge his store and develop his business in order to improve his income and increase sales to improve the quality of life for his children.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and some materials for the store.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 44-year-old private school proprietor in Bamburi, Mombasa. He is married and a father of five school-going children. He has been running this business for the past five years and he is doing great. 

This is David’s third business loan from Kiva's partner, KADET LTD. He plans to construct more classrooms and buy new desks. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and further improve the school. 

He hopes to have the best performing school in the coast province.

loans.use: to construct more classrooms and buy new desks

loans.name: Louange Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LOUANGE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Alice est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Alice est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Alice est mariée à un certain Séverin. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Alice vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Alice vend des produits divers (pâtes alimentaires, conserves, etc.), des chaussures et du pétrole dans une région du Bénin. Alice s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Alice sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LOUANGE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The LOUANGE group is comprised of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Alice, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. 

Alice is 36 and lives in Benin. She is married to Séverin. The couple has three dependent children, and some of them go to school. Alice lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple takes care of the various household needs. 

In order to take care of the various family costs, Alice sells various products (pasta, preserves, etc.), shoes, and gas in a region of Benin. Alice buys her supplies in a market in Benin. 

With the goal of increasing her sales and revenue, Alice, along with the other members of the LOUANGE group, is asking for a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan was repaid.

loans.use: to buy pasta, preserves, and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline for her motorcycle business

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 61 years old. She lives in a small village in the Dusheti District with her husband, Akaki. Ketevan and Akaki run an agricultural business. They have a milking cow and produce cheese.
